moni.quest.15DBB22E3DC0AFB7.description1: All of the Tier Four missions require &6Petrotheum Dust&r.
moni.quest.15DBB22E3DC0AFB7.description2: This tier of Microminer excels at gathering massive batches of basic materials, such as &6Iron&r, &6Gold&r, or &6Redstone&r. Additionally, this microminer will be your first source of &6Neptunium&r.
moni.quest.15DBB22E3DC0AFB7.description3: It is also a convenient source of &6Sheldonite&r, the best choice for creating &6Platinum Group Sludge&r, via a mission requiring &6Wither Realm Data&r.
moni.quest.15DBB22E3DC0AFB7.title: &9Tier Four Microminer
moni.quest.15E34DEC491FAB81.description1: With &6HV Machine Hulls&r made, you've made your first step towards &eHigh Voltage (HV)&r power machinery!
moni.quest.15E34DEC491FAB81.description2: While you can make these in a crafting table with &6Polyethylene Sheets&r, liquid &9Polyethylene&r can be used to craft these directly in an &3Assembling Machine&r.
moni.quest.15E34DEC491FAB81.title: HV Machine Hulls
moni.quest.15FAEE3F625265F4.description1: &2A strong heavy element obtained from the Naquadah chain.
moni.quest.15FAEE3F625265F4.description2: &6Trinium&r can come from &6Kaemanite Ore&r, but you will probably want to bolster its production with &6Naquadah Dust&r processing. It comes out at the second stage, so if you don't mind storing the intermediates and have Fluorine under control, you can hold off doing the full chain if you don't need to yet. You get &91 Trinium per 12 Naquadah processed&r.
moni.quest.15FAEE3F625265F4.description3: This will be required in large quantities for &6Trinium Coils&r, &6Superconducting Coil Blocks&r, and &6Naquadah Alloy&r, among other things. You will need almost 5.5 stacks for a &3Fusion Reactor MK I&r, so stock up on it!
moni.quest.15FAEE3F625265F4.title: &2Trinium
moni.quest.161F61C28DBC5941.description1: The &3Loot Quantum Fabricator&r is a direct upgrade to the &3Loot Super Fabricator&r, allowing the use of Parallel hatches to further boost speed and efficiency.
moni.quest.161F61C28DBC5941.description2: You should probably make this multiblock after already making the &3Simulation Quantum Computer&r.
moni.quest.161F61C28DBC5941.title: &9Loot Quantum Fabricator
moni.quest.16EACCF9B4FA89B3.description1: This is the additive that will bring our diesel fuel to the next level.
moni.quest.16EACCF9B4FA89B3.description2: Mix &9Nitric Acid&r and &9Ethenone&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r to make &9Tetranitromethane&r.
moni.quest.16EACCF9B4FA89B3.description3: In a newly added route, you can also mix &9Nitric Acid&r and &9Methyl Acetate&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r.
moni.quest.16EACCF9B4FA89B3.title: Tetranitromethane
moni.quest.171EE3A4129F19A5.description2: It is a common ingredient in higher tier &6Solar Panels&r.
moni.quest.171EE3A4129F19A5.description3: There is a more efficient recipe made in an IV or better &3Mixer&r, but it'll take a long time to produce so consider stocking it passively.
moni.quest.17312BF0197B87A8.description1: Although most &ealloys&f require an &3Alloy Smelter&f, some alloys can be made simply by mixing the correct metal dusts together.
A mixture of &6Clay, Brick, &cGypsum and Concrete&r produces &6Firebricks&r, used in building the &3Primitive Blast Furnace&r. &c
A mixture of &6Clay and Brick&r produces &6Fireclay&r, used in building the &3Primitive Blast Furnace&r. &c
moni.quest.17312BF0197B87A8.description2: &6Steel&r is one of these alloys, being made by mixing &3Wrought Iron Dust&r with &3Coal Dust&r or &3Charcoal dust&r. &2Steel forms the basis of LV Machine Hulls&r, and allows you to make &6Belt Pouches&r for upgrading your &eTool Belt&r.
So far, your only available route for Concrete is adding Stone Dust, Quartz Sand, Clay and Calcite to a bucket of Water.&r
This allows you to make &6Steel&r from &6Wrought Iron&r (or with &6Iron&r, but its slower). Now you can make &7LV &6Machine Hulls&r!
moni.quest.17312BF0197B87A8.description3: This allows you to make &6Steel&r from &6Wrought Iron&r (or with &6Iron&r, but its slower). Now you can make &7LV &6Machine Hulls&r!
Also allows you to make the &6Belt Pouch&r, to upgrade your &eTool Belt&r.
moni.quest.17312BF0197B87A8.description4: Also allows you to make the &6Belt Pouch&r, to upgrade your &eTool Belt&r.
moni.quest.17312BF0197B87A8.title: &9Steel
moni.quest.1735403C8B0D3FAD.description1: &6Phosphorus&r can be obtained by processing &6Tricalcium Phosphate Ore&r or &6Apatite Ore&r into dust and electrolyzing several times.
moni.quest.1735403C8B0D3FAD.description2: Both ores are found in &6Apatite&r veins.
moni.quest.1735403C8B0D3FAD.title: Phosphorus
moni.quest.174C8EDDEF916209.description1: The &3Slice'N'Splice&r is a machine from &bEnder IO&r.
moni.quest.174C8EDDEF916209.description2: It is used for making monster-head-related items that are components for various things.
moni.quest.174C8EDDEF916209.description3: It needs to be supplied with an Axe and Shears, which are slowly damaged over time as items are crafted.
moni.quest.17B5F089E58BB780.title: Element 094: Plutonium
moni.quest.17E92ED356B6737F.description1: In most expert packs, you want to try to process as little ore as possible before you get access to ore processing. It's a habit most of us pick up.
moni.quest.17E92ED356B6737F.description3: Obvious exceptions would be rare materials or anything you buy with &9Monicoins &fbecause you can't find it. Those are worth doubling, if possible.
The obvious exception would be rare materials; Those are worth doubling, if possible.
The obvious exception would be rare materials; Those are worth doubling, if possible.
moni.quest.17E92ED356B6737F.description4: But at least for now, you shouldn't feel any guilt about smelting the more common ores without doubling them! &eOre Processing can be safely ignored until you have the &2Steam Grinder&r&e or High Voltage machines.&r
moni.quest.17E92ED356B6737F.rich_descrip: Click to go to the quest
You shouldn't feel any pressure to do that in
, though. Ore veins are massive, mining is extremely fast with
Macerators' byproducts aren't available until HV.
moni.quest.17E92ED356B6737F.title: &2Ore Doubling?
moni.quest.186C14C113B6F3AD.description1: Coating &6Cryococcus&r with &6Liquid Nether Star&r and freezing it solid results in a superconductive material capable of transmitting enormous amounts of energy.
moni.quest.186C14C113B6F3AD.description2: These wires losslessly transmit &4UHV&r power, and can also be made into the final form of RF Overclocker that can transmit a whopping &a134 million RF/t&r.
moni.quest.186C14C113B6F3AD.title: Sculk Superconductor
moni.quest.187083EB66D95726.title: Optical Chips
moni.quest.187083EB66D95726.description1: With a &6Heart of a Universe&r and some sapphire, you can start growing &6Sapphire Boules&r. &6Sapphire Wafers&r can be processed into &6Optical Chips&r, ready for use in &6Optical Processors&r.
moni.quest.18D8D18C4494C587.description1: &9GregTech Power&r can be tricky to handle. Luckily, there are several tools you can use to tackle some of the problems.
moni.quest.18D8D18C4494C587.description2: - &aDiode&r: A block which accepts energy on 5 sides, and outputs it on a single side. Its main purpose is to limit Amperage flow through it - adjust it by right-clicking it with a Soft Hammer, &2and to transport power into Cleanrooms.&r Not to be confused with the Diodes used as crafting components.
moni.quest.18D8D18C4494C587.description3: - &aTransformer&r: A block which changes between 4A of a lower voltage and 1A of a voltage one tier higher.
moni.quest.18D8D18C4494C587.description4: * Exists in multiple variants, the biggest of which can transform up to 64A Low <-> 16A High.
moni.quest.18D8D18C4494C587.description5: - &aBattery Buffer&r: A block which can hold GregTech Batteries. Each battery accepts up to 2A and can provide up to 1A. &2They are a very convenient way to buffer power for on-demand automation.
moni.quest.18D8D18C4494C587.title: &2GT Power Management
moni.quest.1903B26C95DD325A.description1: &6QBit CPUs&r are an advanced Circuit Wafer crucial for &6Quantum Circuits&r.
moni.quest.1903B26C95DD325A.description2: There are two methods of creating them:
moni.quest.1903B26C95DD325A.description3: The simpler recipe uses two &6Quantum Eyes&r and two ingots' worth of molten &9Gallium Arsenide&r to enhance a &6NanoCPU Wafer&r. This recipe is slow and requires substantially more &9Radon&r per craft.
moni.quest.1903B26C95DD325A.description4: The other route instead uses &6Indium Gallium Phosphide&r and a tiny amount of Radon. This skips the slow-crafting Quantum Eyes, using far less Radon in the process, but requires the infrastructure in place for obtaining &6Indium&r.
moni.quest.1903B26C95DD325A.description5: The second route is overall better, and you will need Indium processing to complete the pack so might as well do it.
moni.quest.1903B26C95DD325A.title: QBit Processing Unit
moni.quest.19084E91F357C8C2.subtitle: Imbue your factory with infinite power!
moni.quest.19084E91F357C8C2.description1: When fueled, the &3Transdimensional Energy Singularity&r grants unlimited energy to all EU-based machines and energy hatches, removing their need to push or pull power.
moni.quest.19084E91F357C8C2.description2: (Unique multi mechanic code taken from the Cosmic Frontiers team with Caitlynn's gracious permission.)
moni.quest.19084E91F357C8C2.title: &9Creative Power
moni.quest.19233A97579E0BDD.description1: Although you could &emagnetize&r &6Iron Ingots&r by hand using &6Redstone&r, doing that consumes considerable amounts of dust and that's not an option for more advanced materials. This machine will let you magnetize &6Steel Rods&r, as well as even more advanced materials later.
moni.quest.19233A97579E0BDD.description2: &2Polarizer recipes in Moni go up to ZPM.
moni.quest.19233A97579E0BDD.subtitle: Automatic magnetizers
moni.quest.19233A97579E0BDD.title: &2Polarizer
moni.quest.193B7038EAB6EFA3.description1: The &9Nasa Workbench&r is used to create rockets from various parts.
moni.quest.193B7038EAB6EFA3.subtitle: Now it's time to think vertically
moni.quest.193B7038EAB6EFA3.title: &9Gregtech Rocketery
moni.quest.19C2D208A2FC9968.description1: All missions require &6Aerotheum Dust&r. This Microminer can be used to gather more advanced &6Mob Drops&r than the &9Tier 2.5 Microminer&r
moni.quest.19C2D208A2FC9968.description2: This Miner is the only source of &6Wither Realm Data, Deep Dark Data, and Dragon Den Data&r, as well as any boss drops such as &6Dragon Scales&r.
moni.quest.19C2D208A2FC9968.description3: It is also a very good source of &6Nether Stars&r and &6Dragons Breath&r.
moni.quest.19C2D208A2FC9968.title: Tier Four and a Half Microminer
moni.quest.1A30472430354F1E.description1: &9This is where &bEMI&9 really shines! Using it alongside &3Crafting Stations&9, you should be able to easily calculate the amount of raw resources and intermediate components you'll need to &ebatch craft &9electronic circuits quickly.
moni.quest.1A30472430354F1E.description2: You'll be making a LOT&r of circuits, so take advantage of the improved crafting efficiency.
moni.quest.1A30472430354F1E.subtitle: With all of the components made, it's time to craft an &2Electronic Circuit&r.
moni.quest.1A30472430354F1E.title: Your First Circuit
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description1: &bGregTech&r adds a very versatile way of augmenting machines with &aMachine Covers&r. Covers are "upgrades" that you can put on any &eGregTech machine, crate, or drum&r to expand its functionality. These are seperate on each side of the machine, meaning you can have up to six different covers! &9Covers can be edited and removed via the given machine's GUI&r, but for the others, you'll need to make yourself a &aScrewdriver&r to configure covers, and a &aCrowbar&r to remove covers without having to break the machine.
- &lShutter&r: prevents automation from interacting with a specific side of a machine.

- &lDetector&r: Available in Item, Fluid, Energy and Activity flavors, with each having an advanced version for more precise monitoring. Emits a Redstone signal depending on the status of whatever it's detecting.
Covers that move items or fluids can have a &aFilter&r placed inside them. These modify the functionality of covers in ways explained in their own quests.
- &lMachine Controler&r: Allows the enabling/disabling of machines or covers. Can also remove the ability or machines to pause themselves when out of power.
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description2: Here's a list of some covers there are in the game, and what they do:
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description3: - &lConveyor&r: transfers items continuously to or from an adjacent inventory; is capable of round robin.
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description4: - &lPump&r: is much like a &aConveyor&f, but for fluids.
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description5: - &lRobotic Arm&r: is much like a &aConveyor&r, but has two additional modes:
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description6: * &eKeep Exact&r: moves items to keep a stock of at most the specified number of items
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description7: * &eSupply Exact&r: transfers precisely the specified number of items per operation.
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description8: This cover is very useful for crafting automation.
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.description9: - &lFluid Regulator&r: is like a &aRobotic Arm&r, but works with fluids instead of items.
moni.quest.1A427A8CB43C8B59.title: &9Machine Covers
moni.quest.1A693859BD2CDADF.title: Element 014: Silicon
moni.quest.1A6F087E10DC036E.description2:
This final age will put your factory to the ultimate test! Resolve your final infrastructure bottlenecks through the help of &3Infinite power&r and &cMAX&6 Energy Hatches&r.
Will you be able to produce hundreds of &6MAX Circuits&r and thousands of &6Monium&r?
moni.quest.1A6F087E10DC036E.title: &cMAX&r Age
moni.quest.1A80D0AE0B2F7A9D.description1: The &6Steam Foundry&r functions as 5.3 &7LV &3Alloy Smelters&r in parallel! It requires an input of &9Steam&r through a &eSteam Hatch&r, but it uses very little Steam, perfect for bulk crafting alloys or mold recipes.

The &6Steam Foundry&r functions as 5.3 &7LV &3Alloy Smelters&r in parallel! It requires an input of &9Steam&r through a &eSteam Hatch&r, but it uses very little Steam, perfect for bulk crafting alloys or mold recipes.
moni.quest.1A80D0AE0B2F7A9D.description2: You may wish to wait until you have a Bender at LV to reduce the cost.
You may wish to wait until you have a Bender at LV to reduce the cost.
moni.quest.1AA0A089DCA17FC8.description1: Placing a &9Wireless Charger&r in a area that you frequent (such as where you do your crafting) will ensure that your RF-based items are always topped off on energy. &4Does not charge EU-based items!&r
moni.quest.1AA0A089DCA17FC8.subtitle: Because waiting for items to charge is so last version
moni.quest.1AA0A089DCA17FC8.title: &9Charging Items Wirelessly
moni.quest.1AC8700C190E84BC.description1: Managing P2P tunnels can be a pain in large numbers. Thankfully, the &6Advanced Memory Card&r fixes that by allowing you to manage all of your connections within a single card, as well as bind and unbind things on the fly, among other features.
moni.quest.1AC8700C190E84BC.subtitle: They really do have a GUI for everything now
moni.quest.1AC8700C190E84BC.title: &9Better P2P Management
moni.quest.1AC91A3E05215569.description1: &6Bacterial Sludge&r will be used in the Wetware processes. It can also replace &6Europium&r when regrowing &6crystal chips&r.
moni.quest.1AC91A3E05215569.description2: Combining &6Biomass&r with &6Bacteria&r will grant you Bacterial Sludge.
moni.quest.1AC91A3E05215569.description3: You will also get a bit back from growing &6Stem Cells&r later.
moni.quest.1AC91A3E05215569.title: &2Bacterial Sludge
moni.quest.1AE46C1970378083.description1: &3Diamond Furnaces&f are even faster, taking only &a25 ticks&f to smelt an item.
moni.quest.1AE46C1970378083.title: Furnace v6.0
moni.quest.1AFB2AD1A572E1D3.description1: Centrifuge your &6Soul Sand&r to get &6Saltpeter Dust&r, &6Coal Dust&r, &9Oil&r, and some of that original &6Sand&r. This process is quite power-hungry and slow for a main source of these materials, but it'll supplement your other options nicely.
moni.quest.1AFB2AD1A572E1D3.title: Saltpeter, Coal, and Oil
moni.quest.1B04AA7D9AEB2CFA.description1:
The &6Advanced Steam Turbine Generator II&r, as expected, consumes even more &9Steam&r to produce even more power.
At this point the demand for &9Steam&r may get out of hand a little, so you may benefit from looking into the &3Large Steel boiler&3.
moni.quest.1B07DB4D58D43B7C.description1: &6Naquadah Alloy&r requires Naquadah, Osmiridium and Trinium. It will be used in making &6ZPM Machine Hulls&r.
moni.quest.1B07DB4D58D43B7C.title: &2Naquadah Alloy
moni.quest.1B1D3A66B847D129.description1: With these circuits, you have unlocked &2UIV&r, the pentultimate voltage. UIV circuits allow you to craft a variety of things to help improve and redefine your base as you push on.
moni.quest.1B1D3A66B847D129.title: &9The First Tier Eleven Circuit
moni.quest.1B45AA7042D110E4.title: Element 042: Molybdenum
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.description1: The &eTool Belt&r is an item which can store your tools and exchange them easily! Right now, it has 2 slots, but later, once you unlock &6Steel&r, you can upgrade it all the way to 9 slots with &6Belt Pouches&r, an &3Anvil&r, and some &aXP&r!
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.description2: Make the Tool Belt, and you can use the keybind (default is &6R&r), while the belt is in your inventory or Curio Slots &cand you are holding something, or the belt is not empty&r, to open its GUI.
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.description3: Alternatively, you can right click while holding the belt to open its inventory.
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.description4: The Tool Belt is equippable as a &bCurio&r. Open your inventory and look for the Curios button, then click it to reveal the additional bauble slots menu, and put it in the Belt Slot. Or, if you can't tell which bauble slot looks like a belt, just click in every bauble slot until it goes in.
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.description5: The Tool Belt can store anything with a stack size of 1, like swords, pickaxes, &bGregTech&r tools, &bFunctional Storage&r Cards, and the like.

The Tool Belt can store anything with a stack size of 1, like swords, pickaxes, &bGregTech&r tools, and the &6Terminal&r. It has also been modified a bit, so it also allows any &bStorage Drawers&r key, and &cdoesn't allow any Thermal Satchel&r.
The Tool Belt can store anything with a stack size of 1, like swords, pickaxes, &bGregTech&r tools, and the &6Terminal&r. It has also been modified a bit, so it &cdoesn't allow any Thermal Satchel&r.
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.description6: Now, you can insert and extract from the belt! You can also use the Keybinds '&eCycle Tool Left&r' and '&eCycle Tool Right&r' whilst you are in the GUI.
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.subtitle: &2A highly requested mod to help you manage your tools!&r
moni.quest.1B86EF5A24286787.title: &2Tool Belt
moni.quest.1BADB230EB1BEA4D.title: Plutonium
moni.quest.1BADB230EB1BEA4D.description1: &6Stabilized Plutonium&r, needed to obtain &6Naquadah&r, can be made from either &6Plutonium 239&r or &6Plutonium 241&r.
moni.quest.1BADB230EB1BEA4D.description2: Plutonium 239 can be obtained in dust form from a &6T5 Microminer&r mission, or mined as an ore on the planet Mercury. You will need a &6Tier 3 Rocket&r for the latter.
moni.quest.1BADB230EB1BEA4D.description3: Plutonium 241 can be obtained from centrifuging Plutonium 239 dust. Later on, you can also obtain it through a &6MKII Fusion Reactor&r
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description1: The &3Electric Blast Furnace&r is a major, major milestone in your &bGregTech&r career. It has the power to smelt more advanced materials. The first of these, &6Aluminium&r, is going to be important in the immediate future.
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description2: Since smelting &6Aluminium&r requires MV power, you're going to have to power this with 2 LV Energy Input Hatches.
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description3: There is a diagram of how to build the EBF in &bEMI&r. The second and third levels must be a 3x3 square shape of Coil Blocks (&6Cupronickel&r is the only type of coil block you have access to for now) with an empty center. You can also &6sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description4: However, the bottom and top layers are very flexible. The &6EBF Controller&r must be on the &ebottom layer&r of the structure, and on the &emiddle of an outer edge&r; the &6Muffler Hatch&r must be in the &eexact middle of the top layer&r. Otherwise, you can put the hatches and buses wherever you want, filling in all the gaps in each layer with &6Heatproof Machine Casings&r. It's worth noting that you must &euse at least &29&e Heatproof Machine Casings in your layout or the structure will not form&r.
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description5: This quest calls for a &2maintenance hatch&r, two energy hatches, a fluid input and output, and an item input and output, which is a total of 7 positions. Their specific order and placement don't matter, as long as you can access them. The 8th position is your EBF controller, leaving 9 gaps to be filled by Heatproof Machine Casings. If you did everything right, the structure will form: the colors on its hatches and casings will unify, and the controller will say "Idling."
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description6: Hatches and Buses can be replaced by Hatches and Buses of any tier, although the Input Bus must be at least LV, as there are 2 inputs.
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description7: You'll most likely want to locate your power quite near to the EBF. It is very power hungry, and if it cannot get enough energy, progress on the current item smelting will start to regress. Be careful to ensure the EBF has enough power, and keep a Soft Hammer nearby to pause it by tapping the controller if you run out of power.
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.description8: &2In Gregtech, all hatches except Maintenance and Parallel Control can be shared between Multiblocks!
moni.quest.1BC6DDC2D50F9C46.title: &2Blast Furnace Fun
moni.quest.1C0B4DC262FDB94E.description1: &bGregTech&r adds several ways to manage fluids. There are options are including, but not limited to:
moni.quest.1C0B4DC262FDB94E.description5: All of these are &2very useful&r tools, and will be used extensively throughout the game.
moni.quest.1C0B4DC262FDB94E.title: All About Fluids!
moni.quest.1C861E0C62D5B97D.description1: Imbue your factory with the Wisdom of the Universe by running the &3ORB&r: While this multiblock is active, all your data access hatches will act like they have every research data available to them! &9One could even break causality with this technology...&r
moni.quest.1C861E0C62D5B97D.description2: (Unique multi mechanic code taken from the Cosmic Frontiers team with Caitlynn's gracious permission.)
moni.quest.1C861E0C62D5B97D.subtitle: In the end, no answer is ever as elegant as its question.
moni.quest.1C861E0C62D5B97D.title: &9Omniscience Research Beacon
moni.quest.1CA3A00393EDD648.description1: The &3Sculk Vat&r is a multiblock capable of growing Sculk products as well as other micro-organisms.
moni.quest.1CA3A00393EDD648.description2:
Recipes run in the Vat will produce less and less output the farther the output hatch is from half full, producing the amount listed in &bEMI&r at exactly 50%% and up to 8x less as the hatch approaches completely empty or full. Note that the amount a recipe will produce is decided as soon as the recipe starts.
&2While an optimal setup maintaining an exact 50% fill level is possible, it is not at all necessary to beat the pack and an approximate setup can still be viable all the way to the end.&r
moni.quest.1CA3A00393EDD648.description3: The Vat can also store experience for use in growing Sculk. Do this by inserting &6XP Juice&r into a &6Sculk XP Draining Hatch&r. Every second, the Draining Hatch will deposit all XP Juice it has into the internal buffer of the Vat, and the amount of XP inside the Vat will decay by 1/64 of the amount it currently has stored.
moni.quest.1CA3A00393EDD648.description4: The amount of XP currently in the Vat can be seen in the Vat's GUI, or read out as a redstone signal using a &6Sculk XP Sensor Hatch&r.
moni.quest.1CA3A00393EDD648.description5: Some recipes require the amount of XP in the Vat to be within a specific range, shown in &bEMI&r, otherwise the recipe will regress.
moni.quest.1CA6D620309F2B9E.description1: Obtaining &6Grains of Infinity&r will require you to mine all the way down to Bedrock level.
moni.quest.1CA6D620309F2B9E.description2: You can automate grains of infinity using a &3Rock Breaker&r at a low Y coordinate with &6Lava&r and &6Fluid of the Void&r adjcent to the machine. You could alternatively use a &3Rock Cycle Simulator&r to bypass the fluid adjacency requirements.
moni.quest.1CA6D620309F2B9E.title: Grains Of Infinity
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description1: The &6Machine Controller&r is a cover that manages the operation of &bGregTech&r machines, similar to a &aSoft Hammer&r. These are crucial for &epassive automation&r, where a machine is dedicated to keeping something in stock for you.
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description2: "Machines" here is broader than you might think. It of course works on single-block machines, but can also be used on &eMultiblock Controllers&r like your &3Electronic Blast Furnace&r. But it's even more flexible than that: you can use it on any &bGregTech&r block that accepts transfer covers, as long as the controllable cover is placed on it first! This means it also works for things like &6Chests&r, &6Drums&r, and Multiblock inputs.
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description3: The cover works by detecting a &eredstone signal&r. By default, the entire machine will be disabled if a sufficiently strong signal is detected by the cover.
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description4: When you open the Machine Controller's GUI with a &aScrewdriver&r, you will see several options for configuring its behavior:
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description5: The strength of the signal required to trigger the Machine Controller is configurable using the top slider.
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description6: Another button allows you to select whether to control the whole machine (where applicable) or a specific cover. This lets you do things like stop moving items into a machine, but also allow the machine to continue working.
moni.quest.1CB14AC299A8EDD9.description7: Switching from &eNormal&r to &eInverted&r mode will make the Machine Controller instead disable the machine until it receives the requisite redstone signal. This is often preferable when working with &6Level Emitters&r to prevent machines from starting up if your &eME Network&r is offline.
moni.quest.1CC092A2F2CD4589.description1: You'll need at least &6Naquadah Coil Blocks&r in your blast furnace to smelt &6Cryolobus&r, as well as a healthy supply of certain liquid fuels to reach the immense heat it takes to liquefy.
moni.quest.1CC092A2F2CD4589.description2: Cryolobus gets so hot that it requires the potent coolant &9Gelid Cryotheum&r to aid your &3Vacuum Freezer&r in turning it into usable ingots.
moni.quest.1CC092A2F2CD4589.description3: There are several ways to make Cryolobus: dust can be smelted into ingots, but you can also turn &6Warden Tendrils&r, which contain Cryolobus, directly into ingots. It uses a lot of combustion fuel, but is the best use of excess &6Warden Tendrils&r.
moni.quest.1CC092A2F2CD4589.title: &9Cryolobus Ingots
moni.quest.1CEFFF8EE1E4B6EE.title: Neptunium
moni.quest.1CEFFF8EE1E4B6EE.description1: &6Neptunium&r can be obtained from a &6Tier Four Microminer&r mission. Much later, you will be able to use Naqudah Chemistry as a better source.
moni.quest.1CF77095C203454F.description1: Upgraded form of the &3Alloy Blast Smelter&r.
moni.quest.1CF77095C203454F.description2: Accepts any &6Parallel Control Hatch&r, parallelizing up to &e4096x&r with the best hatch!
moni.quest.1CF77095C203454F.description3: If you don't already have &6Neutronium&r, you will need to get some to make this.
moni.quest.1CF77095C203454F.title: &2Mega Alloy Blast Smelter
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.description1: Your &3Chemical Reactors&r will be making a lot of different fluids. You'll need to manage the logistics of routing and storing all the different fluids you're automating.
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.description2: Wherever possible, having one Chemical Reactor output directly into another machine that needs its output chemical saves you from having to figure out additional storage and routing. &aFluid Filters&r and &aPump covers&r are very useful for moving fluids around a compact processing pipeline.
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.description3: But what about the final output fluids that you need elsewhere?
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.description4: One option is to use the output tanks of the Chemical Reactors as a small storage buffer, letting it back up and stop crafting automatically. A &aStorage Bus&r on the machine will expose the fluid to your ME Network. Whenever you need some of this fluid, your AE2 system will pull the needed fluid out and the machine will resume processing.
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.description5: There's some catches with this approach though. First is that a &aStorage Bus&r is bidirectional by default. You will want to set the Storage Bus to &eExtract Only&r so AE doesn't try to store random fluids and items in the Chemical Reactor, and you may want to &ereduce the priority&r of the Storage Bus as well: this will signal to AE that you want it to remove fluids from that location first. Also, if multiple fluids are produced, &ethe machine will not resume processing if it doesn't have room for all fluid outputs&r.
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.description6: When you get access to them, it's probably just better to use single-fluid-formatted &aFluid Storage Cells&r and dump outputs into AE via Interfaces. You can fill up the cells, then pull the fluids out wherever else you need them. An alternative to this is storage buses on &3Gregtech Tanks and Drums&r.
moni.quest.1D0DF2330B113B7A.title: Fluid Logistics
moni.quest.1D3A5DCCE1B40D29.description1:
These are the basic cables used by &3Applied Energistics&r to transport network connectivity. Since channels are disabled in all modes but Expert Mode, these cables will most likely be your main method of transporting network connectivity, rather than the dense cables.
&eThe mechanics of AE2 Channels are outside the scope of the quest book, and this is the only time it will be mentioned.
moni.quest.1D3A5DCCE1B40D29.description2: These cables do not share blockspace with cables for other mods, so they can be somewhat unwieldy to build with, but they do accept &3Applied Energistics &6Facades&r, so they can be hidden very easily. Keep in mind that a large number of facades leads to FPS lag.
moni.quest.1D3A5DCCE1B40D29.subtitle: AE Networking
moni.quest.1D3A5DCCE1B40D29.title: ME Cables
moni.quest.1D4B663AD87CA3C1.description1: Split your &6Clay Dust&r to make &6Sodium Dust&r, &6Silicon Dust&r, &6Lithium Dust&r, and &6Aluminium Dust&r.&r This is extremely important to passive, as you will need a lot of these resources, and this is the best way to get them.
moni.quest.1D4B663AD87CA3C1.title: Sodium, Silicon, Lithium and Aluminium
moni.quest.1D5D25F52BE6709E.title: Element 89: Actinium
moni.quest.1DB3CCC10C0EB1A8.description2: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r into a &6Hot Nichrome Ingot&r which will damage you if it is held. To prevent this damage and obtain the desired ingot, the Hot Ingot must be cooled in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r.
moni.quest.1DB3CCC10C0EB1A8.description3: It is best to directly route this Hot Ingot from the &6Output Bus&r of your Blast Furnace to the &6Input Bus&r of your &3Vacuum Freezer&r via pipes or a &6Tag Filter&r set to 'forge:hot_ingots' with a high priority.
moni.quest.1DB3CCC10C0EB1A8.title: Nichrome Ingots
moni.quest.1DBBE96165C7987D.description2: For now, you'll be using it to make &6Energetic Alloy Dust&r which is made from &6Redstone&r, &6Gold Dust&r and &6Glowstone Dust&r.
moni.quest.1DBBE96165C7987D.description3: You can get some Glowstone by mixing &6Tricalcium Phosphate Dust&r and &6Gold Dust&r.
moni.quest.1DBBE96165C7987D.subtitle: Will it blend?
moni.quest.1DBBE96165C7987D.title: LV Mixer
moni.quest.1DFF7C35B5B26B80.description1: Nothing you haven't seen here: just combine some standard circuit components and &6Nanoprocessors&r to make &6Nanoprocessor Assemblies&r.
moni.quest.1DFF7C35B5B26B80.title: The Second Tier Four Circuits
moni.quest.1E36AFB19932C805.description1: &6Complex SMD Components&r are required for &6Extradimensional circuits&r. They can alternatively be substituted for the equivalent of 4 advanced SMD components.
moni.quest.1E36AFB19932C805.description2: If you haven't made it already, you will need &6Polyethyl Cyanoacrylate&r.
moni.quest.1E36AFB19932C805.title: &9Complex SMD Components
moni.quest.1E498F509DB1D460.description1: Give me a little juice, FRIDAY!
moni.quest.1E498F509DB1D460.title: Infinity War
moni.quest.1E6CDC008C85D941.description1: Reconstruct your &6Sand&r into &6Soul Sand&r. Aside from the vanilla applications of Bubble Elevators and summoning the &eWither&r, Soul Sand is used to alloy &6Soularium&r and can be centrifuged for resources.
moni.quest.1EA5F30C5ACADBA9.title: Microverse Decay
moni.quest.1EA5F30C5ACADBA9.description1: Tier 4+ Microminer missions that require the &3Advanced Microverse Projector&r are quite taxing on the projected Microverse. As the recipes run, the Integrity of the microverse depletes. The total depletion a recipe causes can be seen in &bEMI&r.
moni.quest.1EA5F30C5ACADBA9.description2: To combat this decay, &6Quantum Flux&r can be used to patch up the microverse. By placing the Flux in any input bus, it will be automatically consumed to repair the microverse, regardless of if a recipe is running. Each Flux repairs 1%%, and is only consumed if more than 1%% is missing.
moni.quest.1EA5F30C5ACADBA9.description3: Note that the above behavior is specific to Normal microverses. &eEach microverse type repairs in different ways&r, so make sure to ready their quests!
moni.quest.1EA5F30C5ACADBA9.description4: If a Microverse does reach 0 Integrity, it will collapse, and the microminer on the mission will be returned, but nothing else. You will have to project a new microverse to run more recipes.
moni.quest.1EA5F30C5ACADBA9.description5: The stability of the microverse can be read out in the form of a redstone signal using the &6Microverse Stability Sensor Hatch&r.
moni.quest.1EBF9D9EADB7C451.description1: &2You can make HV Batteries like LV and MV ones, but there is a better option.
moni.quest.1EBF9D9EADB7C451.description2: &2Energium Crystals can store 6,400,000 EU, at the cost of some crafting complexity. They need an HV Autoclave.
moni.quest.1EBF9D9EADB7C451.title: &2HV Power Storage
moni.quest.1F0EE20B26083680.description1: &2Electric Pumps are used to transfer fluid to and from machines, into fluid pipes,fluid tanks and drums.
moni.quest.1F0EE20B26083680.description2: &6Electric Pumps&r can be attached to &bGregTech&r machines, tanks, drums, hatches and pipes as covers. To access these you can either shift+right click with an empty hand, or right click with a &6screwdriver&r in-world. You can also access them in a machines GUI.
moni.quest.1F0EE20B26083680.description3: Unlike fluid pipes, Electric Pumps &9don't have a temperature limit&r, only a limit on how much fluid they can move per game tick. Each new tier of pump you get, up to &3UV&r, will transfer &64x more fluid&r per tick than the last tier.
moni.quest.1F0EE20B26083680.description4: Single block &bGregTech&r machines can auto-output fluids on one side, so you don't always need a pump to export fluid from a machine.
moni.quest.1F0EE20B26083680.title: Electric Pumps
moni.quest.1F101D4F758ACECB.description1: With the &3Advanced Circuit Assembling Machine&r, a new theme of Circuits is available.
moni.quest.1F101D4F758ACECB.title: &2MV Circuit Assembler
moni.quest.1F2E76FA4B2C2E84.description1: &9Heavy Fuel&r is mixed with &9Light Fuel&r to create &9Diesel&r.
moni.quest.1F2E76FA4B2C2E84.title: Heavy Fuel
moni.quest.1F7F73BF81570F3C.subtitle: unlocks hm and em quests
moni.quest.1F7F73BF81570F3C.title: &eNot NM
moni.quest.1F7FD354C79771A1.description2: The &3Cutting Machine&r is able to cut wafers, rods, wood, and various other things for you, making it a versatile crafting tool. Cutting blocks into 9 plates may be faster than using a &2Bender &rto make them one at a time.
moni.quest.1F7FD354C79771A1.description3: The MV version is required for cutting &6Silicon Boules&r for easier &6Diodes&r once you get &9Polyethylene (PE)&r, and for cutting &6Wafers&r into usable components.
moni.quest.1F7FD354C79771A1.description4: The blade will require you to make &2Vanadium Steel&r.
moni.quest.1F7FD354C79771A1.description5: Cutting Machines work with plain &9Water&r for all recipes. You can also use &9Distilled Water&r which speeds up the processing somewhat, or &9Lubricant&r that speeds it up greatly (and uses very little per operation). These might be a little tricky to make right now, but are very worthwhile upgrades in the future.
moni.quest.1F7FD354C79771A1.title: &2MV Cutter
moni.quest.1F976B197DEFF654.title: &9Hardened Backpack
moni.quest.1FF5C2A3CAB76088.description1: Nothing new here, just use more standard circuit stuff and you can upgrade a pair of &6Quantum Processors&r into &6Quantum Processor Assemblies&r.
moni.quest.1FF5C2A3CAB76088.title: The Third Tier Five Circuit
moni.quest.1FF652D16CE97C79.rich_descrip: Also useful as a machine cover for continuously moving items. Read the
quest for more info on the various covers.
moni.quest.1FF652D16CE97C79.subtitle: Not as common a component, but used in a number of critical machines.
moni.quest.1FF652D16CE97C79.title: LV Conveyor
moni.quest.20116A38B08BA7A3.title: Element 046: Palladium
moni.quest.201B129579ACF449.description1: Separate your &6Quartz Sand&r into &6Quartzite Dust&r and &6Certus Quartz Dust&r. This is a good renewable source of &6Certus Quartz&r, which you need for &bApplied Energistics 2&r.
moni.quest.201B129579ACF449.title: Quartzite and Certus Quartz Dust
moni.quest.20745EB9A695E365.description1: &aLasers&r are &9GregTech&r's native solution to high-volume power transfer. Each power tier starting at &9IV&r has &aLaser Hatches&r capable of transferring &9256A&r, &91,024A&r and &94,096A&r of their voltage's power!
moni.quest.20745EB9A695E365.description2: Energy in the Laser Network flows from &aLaser Source Hatches&r through &6Laser Pipes&r to &aLaser Target Hatches&r. All these must be in a straight line - lasers don't bend, after all. Similarly to other power-related blocks, the tier of the &aLaser Target&r must not be lower than the tier of the &aLaser Source&r.
moni.quest.20745EB9A695E365.description3: You can choose to use these when moving power between &3Active Transformers&r and your &3Power Substation&r.
moni.quest.20745EB9A695E365.title: &2Laser Network
moni.quest.20CB8F878CADA235.description1: &9Bathyal Energy Cores&r are the second tier of core, used for intermediate crafting recipes.
moni.quest.20CB8F878CADA235.title: &9Bathyal Energy Core
moni.quest.21654B6E703A2923.description1: Compact your &6Sand&r into &6Sandstone&r. It is recommended to use &3Ender IO Crafters&r or a &6Compressor&r.
moni.quest.2179B83440CEF343.description1: Circuits along this line are IV, and can all be substituted in recipes.
moni.quest.2179B83440CEF343.description2: The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in larger quantities and is overall easier to produce.
moni.quest.2179B83440CEF343.title: IV Circuits
moni.quest.217F85D6FE2A467D.description1: &6ZPM Machine Hulls&r are made with &2Naquadah Alloy Plates,&r but you'll notice they also need &2Polybenzimidazole&r.
moni.quest.217F85D6FE2A467D.description2: ZPM stands for Zero Point Module.
moni.quest.217F85D6FE2A467D.title: &2ZPM Machine Hulls
moni.quest.2181102841205407.description1: With the Advanced Crafting Table, you can now craft 5x5 recipes.
moni.quest.2181102841205407.description2: &9You can automate Extended Crafting recipes before you get PackagedAuto by converting your Extended Crafting tables into autocrafting tables.
moni.quest.2181102841205407.title: &9Advanced Crafting Table
moni.quest.21B16C005E9E3B0E.description1: &2The Large Chemical Reactor (LCR) is a multiblock Chemical Reactor with more input/output slots.&r
All &9Overclocks&r in the &3LCR&r are &6100%% efficient&r; each overclock will &5quadruple the speed&r, as opposed to doubling it. This type of overclock is called a Perfect Overclock.
moni.quest.21B16C005E9E3B0E.description2: The &3LCR&r can also perform some exclusive reactions which allow you to combine multiple normal &3Chemical Reactor&r steps into a &6single step&r, such as:
moni.quest.21B16C005E9E3B0E.description8: The &3LCR&r also is required to perform some recipes, such as &aRaw Gasoline&r production, and &aPolybenzimidazole&r.
moni.quest.21B16C005E9E3B0E.description9: Any other recipe which could be done in a normal &9Chemical Reactor&r, as well as certain &9Mixer&r recipes, can also be done in an &3LCR&r.
moni.quest.21B16C005E9E3B0E.title: &2Large Chemical Reactor
moni.quest.21B917932F5B25BA.description1: You'll need a variety of &alenses&r for use in &3Precision Laser Engravers&r, all of which are made in the &2Lathe&r.
moni.quest.21B917932F5B25BA.description2: Initially you'll need a &a&3&2Ruby Lens&r. Soon you will need &2Diamond, Emerald, and Sapphire Lenses. &2You can choose to use an MV Lathe to get a lens from a plate, or sift for an Exquisite Gem and use an LV Lathe.
moni.quest.21B917932F5B25BA.title: &2Lenses
moni.quest.21CD97B41E37D290.description1: You can crush your &6Bio Chaff&r into &6Dirt&r if you don't feel like tearing up tons of topsoil.
moni.quest.21E10888F52A3C73.description1: The &3Large Naquadah Reactor&r is an upgraded reactor that can generate immense amounts of EU energy from burning liquid &6Naquadah Fuels&r. These fuels are more complicated than the fuel rods, but will generate massive amounts of power in return.
moni.quest.21E10888F52A3C73.description2: You will need quite robust Fusion infrastructure to make all of the &6Tritanium&r needed for the coils.
moni.quest.21E10888F52A3C73.title: &9Large Naquadah Reactor
moni.quest.2201391DEEBE79E4.description1: Provide your &3Simulation Chamber&r with RF power and &6Pulsating Prediction Matrixes&r. Then insert a &6Data Model&r of your choice. The Simulation Chamber will consume Prediction Matrixes and a decent amount of power to begin simulating mob kills. This will generate &6Overworldian Matter&r and may occasionally provide you with &6Mob Predictions&r.
moni.quest.2201391DEEBE79E4.description2: &6Overworldian Matter&r can be eaten to gain experience, or combined with other materials to obtain drops from Overworld mobs, as well as other forms of matter. With these drops and the other kinds of matter, you can then create Data Models for lots of other mob types!
moni.quest.2201391DEEBE79E4.title: &2Overworld&r Matter
moni.quest.22144A6785524FDF.rich_descrip: While the charger itself has extreme throughput, it is recommended to either create a
or keep the cores themselves in stock, as a single core requires 200 million RF to craft.
moni.quest.22144A6785524FDF.title: &9Sculk Core
moni.quest.227F448DFCC3E8C3.description2: &6Mana Dust&r is an important material. It is needed for a variety of materials related to &bThermal Expansion&r.
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description1: &oNote: this quest accepts a Power Unit of any voltage (LV, MV, HV, EV \& IV).&r
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description2: With &bGregTech &6Power Storage&r unlocked, you can make &aPower Units&r for electric GT tools.
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description3: Check if that tool has that tier first! &6Drills&r are available at all tiers, the &6Wrench&r is available at &7LV&r, &6HV&r and &9IV&r, and the other electric tools, such as &6Chainsaws&r and &6Screwdrivers&r are only available at &7LV&r.
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description4: &2A new addition among them is the Drill, which at LV tier can mine a 3x3x1 area of blocks, and at MV tier can mine a 3x3x3 area of blocks.
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description5: Higher tier drills can mine 5x5x5, 7x7x7 and 9x9x9 areas! Shift-right-click to change the breaking area.&r
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description6: Charge these with a &6Battery&r of appropriate tier, or in an appropriately tiered &3Machine&r, &3Battery Buffer&r or &3Turbo Charger&r.
moni.quest.2280472741683581.description7: You may want to look into &6Chainsaws&r for mass tree felling as well, or a &6Wrench&r for breaking machines very quickly. The other electric tools are probably not worth making.
moni.quest.2280472741683581.title: GregTech Electric Tools
moni.quest.228E46FDEBF7F389.title: Element 011: Sodium
moni.quest.22A4734F1B1F379D.description1: As the name would suggest, this chapter is all about &6Logistics&r. How to route and manage everything your base needs.
moni.quest.22A4734F1B1F379D.description2: This chapter will be split into 3 distinct sections: &6Items, Fluids, and Energy&r.
moni.quest.22A4734F1B1F379D.title: All About Logistics
moni.quest.22B3F2351CB4B7D8.description1: Circuits along this line are EV, and can all be substituted in recipes.
moni.quest.22B3F2351CB4B7D8.description2: The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in larger quantities and is overall easier to produce.
moni.quest.22B3F2351CB4B7D8.title: EV Circuits
moni.quest.22E50A6923EBF5CB.description1: &6Neutronium&r is a hyper-dense material normally found in the hearts of neutron stars: the collapsed cores of stars between ten and thirty times the size of the Sun.
moni.quest.22E50A6923EBF5CB.description2: Fun fact: a single neutronium block is approximately 2884 million metric tons and somewhere around 600000K, yet you're somehow capable of holding one with your bare hands. Don't think about it too much.
moni.quest.22E50A6923EBF5CB.description3: Your first neutronium will be obtained from the &6T8 Microminer&r or &3Mk3 Fusion Reactor&r.
moni.quest.22E50A6923EBF5CB.description4: Later on, you might consider using &6T9 Microminers&r or &3Naquadah Chemistry&r to boost your neutronium production.
moni.quest.22E50A6923EBF5CB.title: &2Neutronium Ingot
moni.quest.2341171A4123D584.description1: This works like the pattern access terminal, but can also &9search for patterns&r, and &9highlight &6Pattern Providers&9 in world&r.
moni.quest.2341171A4123D584.title: &9Extended Pattern Access Terminal
moni.quest.2343B68110805282.description1: An amalgamation of empowered gems that is needed for the final circuit tier.
moni.quest.235C1E5B2C58B5AF.description1: &6Hadal Shards&r are a component in &9Hadal Energy Cores&r and &9Hadal Warp Engines&r.
moni.quest.235C1E5B2C58B5AF.description2: They come exclusively from Tier Eight Microminers. You'll need the Tier Seven Microminer for the &6Lair of the Warden Data&r.
moni.quest.235C1E5B2C58B5AF.title: &9Hadal Shards
moni.quest.2396EF225839C65D.description1: Like other petroleum products, &9Sulfuric Gas&r &2or Natural Gas&r is hydrodesulfurized into &9Refinery Gas&r using &9Hydrogen&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r.
moni.quest.2396EF225839C65D.description2: Refinery Gas can be cracked and further distilled for its constituents, but it is also useful as fuel for &3Gas Turbines&r. While it can be burned directly, centrifuging Refinery Gas produces &9LPG&r (Liquefied Petroleum Gas), which is an ideal fuel for Gas Turbines, and &9Methane&r which is a potential (suboptimal) turbine fuel but is also useful for various chemical reactions.
moni.quest.2396EF225839C65D.title: &2Refinery Gas
moni.quest.23A867EC14368388.description1: Glowing! &9But all the GTM machines glow already if Shimmer is installed, so...&r
moni.quest.23A867EC14368388.description2: This one takes a significant amount of time to cook, so make sure to have it going constantly.
moni.quest.23A867EC14368388.description3: Wires made from &6Lumium&r transmit IV power losslessly, and it forms part of the basis for &6LuV Machine Hulls&r.
moni.quest.241FADD2C751BE74.description1: The ultimate item storage component in base &bApplied Energistics&r.
moni.quest.241FADD2C751BE74.description2: These have a massive capacity, hundreds of times that of a &61k ME Storage Component&r.
moni.quest.241FADD2C751BE74.subtitle: &9New to Monifactory!&r
moni.quest.241FADD2C751BE74.title: &9256k Item Storage
moni.quest.24312649E417990B.title: ME Requesters
moni.quest.24312649E417990B.description1: &6ME Requesters&r allow you to select items that will be automatically requested when their stock drops below a specified level. They also allow you to set how large a batch will be requested.
moni.quest.24312649E417990B.description2: &6ME Requester Terminals&r allows you to see and edit all Requesters on the network.
moni.quest.24415A26E5A0FD72.description1: Mix &9Oxygen&r and &9Dimethylhydrazine&r together to make &9Rocket Fuel&r.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description1: The &2Cleanroom&r is a hollow multiblock free of contaminants. Going forward, most new circuit-related recipes, as well as some unique things like &3Fusion Casings&r, will need to be run in machines inside a Cleanroom. This is another ported &5GT5u&r feature, but just like with &aMaintenance&r, it won't be nearly as harsh.
You will also need an &3Energy &rand &3Maintenance Hatch &rfor cleaning. &3Cleanroom Glass&r can replace any &3Plascrete&r, apart from the edges.
If you're facing issues forming the Cleanroom:
- The wall space must be at least 75%% &3Plascrete&r or &3Cleanroom Glass&r. The floor block directly under the controller must also be &3Plascrete&r or &3Cleanroom Glass&r.
- GT generators and Muffler Hatches are &cnot allowed&r in Cleanrooms.
- Try rotating the controller with a wrench, or for even side lengths, try the other central positions.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description2: Once built, it must be well-maintained and powered for a while to clean the inside. The Cleanroom's power draw will decrease once it fully cleans itself. Recipes requiring the Cleanroom will &conly&r run when inside a &cfully-cleaned&r Cleanroom; if not, the recipe will not start, or recipe progress might be lost. (Recipe inputs will &enever be voided&r.)
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description3: The Cleanroom can be built in any size between 5x5x5 and 15x15x15. The Controller is placed in the center of the top face, and the rest of the top face is built from &3Filter Casings&r, save for the edges and corners. The rest of the wall and floor space is filled with &3Plascrete&r.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description4: For transfer between the clean environment and the outside world:
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description5: - Items and fluids through &3Passthrough Hatches&r. They automatically input from one side and output from the opposite side.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description6: - Energy through &bGregTech &3Hulls&r or &3Diodes&r (of any tier). Note that Diodes can transport up to &e16 amps&r, whilst Hulls can only transport &e1 amp&r.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description7: - Your AE network through &bGregTech&r &3Hulls&r (of any tier).
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description8: - Players through &3Doors&r of any kind. The room remains clean when doors are opened.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.description9: Apart from the "official" solutions, non-physical methods of transfer such as &3Ender Chests&r might be effective. &bApplied Energistics&r &3P2P Tunnels&r may also fit your liking.
moni.quest.244F2CC5484A7B21.title: &2Cleanroom
moni.quest.247F4985B9ACE568.description1: Even simple rockets demand &6Double Plates&r for their construction. In this case, made out of &6Steel&r.
moni.quest.248ABB7F26EB72EE.description1: &6Optical Circuits&r and those that follow it are far more expensive than previous circuit themes, requiring Sapphire wafers or chips imbued with &6Hearts of A Universe&r.
moni.quest.248ABB7F26EB72EE.description2: Don't let that discourage you, though. They unlock many useful tools to add to your factory.
moni.quest.248ABB7F26EB72EE.title: &9The Fourth And Final Tier Seven Circuits
moni.quest.24FC29C2D5E3A76E.title: Element 013: Aluminium
moni.quest.254D6D1470BC197E.title: LuV Assembler
moni.quest.254D6D1470BC197E.description1: The &3Elite Assembler II&r grants access to &dLuV&r-tier recipes, such as &6Naquadah Coils&r and &6Ludicrous Voltage Coils&r.
moni.quest.259CC99CE1FB22A9.description1: Right click to select any biome, and the compass will lead you right to it!
moni.quest.25B0271106684DF7.description1: &6TNT&r is an explosive made from &9Toluene&r, a distillation byproduct of &9Wood Tar&r or various &eSteam-Cracked Fuels&r. Besides its typical uses in Minecraft, it is a crafting ingredient you can use in the &3Implosion Compressor&r.
moni.quest.25B0271106684DF7.title: TNT
moni.quest.2607F8404B56773B.description1: The &bPhytogenic Insolator&r is a way to &9passively produce wood in the earlygame&r. While somewhat slow, it only requires &a10 rf/t&r to operate, meaning you can just set it down and not have to worry about it, and then come back to wood when you need some for crafting or steel production.
moni.quest.2607F8404B56773B.description2: Using &bHardened Integral Components&r in it will cause it to work 1.5x faster, while only requiring an extra &a5 rf/t&r to operate, and using &6Bonemeal&r or otherwise will boost how much wood you get per cycle.
moni.quest.2607F8404B56773B.description3: By the way, &bThermal&r Machines are capable of Automatic I/O, try placing a 2x2 drawer beside your &bPhytogenic Insolator&r and configuring it to both push to and pull from the side with the drawer.
moni.quest.2607F8404B56773B.subtitle: …and crops as well, I guess.
moni.quest.2607F8404B56773B.title: &9Infinite Wood
moni.quest.2612A01CCC73DF1A.description1: Separate &6Iron Dust&r out from your &6Amethyst Dust&r. This is a cheap and easy source of &6Iron&r, which we can turn into &6Steel&r without any additonal inputs.
moni.quest.261F7D50E23B0789.description1: The final step. Combine &6Pulsating Dust&r and &6Clay&r to make &6Pulsating Prediction Matrix&r.
moni.quest.261F7D50E23B0789.description2: Take note that a &3&3Chemical Reactor&r making &6Resonant Clathrate&r will supply 1 &3Alloy Smelter&r of the same tier, and that one &bMV &3Alloy Smelter&r making &6Pulsating Prediction Matrix&r supports 10.03 &3Simulation Chambers&r, with each higher tier doubling the amount of &3Simulation Chambers&r it supports.
moni.quest.261F7D50E23B0789.description3: &eTo prevent flooding your alloy smelter with too much &6Clay&e or &6Pulsating Dust&e. Put 2 item containers(for example, &6Chest&e or a &bSophisticated Storage&6 Barrel&e) next to the alloy smelter, and put robot arms on the alloy smelter facing the chests, set them to import and keep exact, and set the amount to keep to 64 or less.
moni.quest.26380A0FD7A8688C.title: Element 079: Gold
moni.quest.2664406B3CD20703.description1: Split your &6Clay Dust&r to make &6Sodium Dust&r, &6Silicon Dust&r, &6Lithium Dust&r, and &6Aluminium Dust&r.&r This is extremely important to passive, as you will need a lot of these resources, and this is the best way to get them.
moni.quest.2664406B3CD20703.title: Sodium, Silicon, Lithium and Aluminium
moni.quest.26C9F1514FD08C81.description1: Placing these in one of your &6ME Drives&r will provide your ME network with an &ainfinite&r amount of water or cobblestone. Use &6Interfaces&r or &6Export Buses&r to provide said substances to wherever you need it.
moni.quest.26C9F1514FD08C81.subtitle: It doesn't get any faster than this.
moni.quest.26C9F1514FD08C81.title: &9Infinitest Water and Stone
moni.quest.26CA20E74A62FA6E.description1: With &6Enderium&r, you can assemble a &6Crystal Processor Supercomputer&r.
moni.quest.26CA20E74A62FA6E.title: &2The Second Tier Seven Circuits
moni.quest.26ECEC06CCAB3E56.description2: These can be made into circuit boards as a substrate for advanced circuits.
moni.quest.26ECEC06CCAB3E56.title: Epoxy
moni.quest.271B184131614D97.title: Element 036: Krypton
moni.quest.273F3F8DD6A3DCC5.description1: If you can't find one otherwise, &6Ender Pearls&r can be crafted using Pulsating Dust and a &6Diamond&r in an &3Alloy Smelter&r.
moni.quest.273F3F8DD6A3DCC5.subtitle: A mysterious alloy, made from &6Pulsating Dust&r and &6Iron&r.
moni.quest.273F3F8DD6A3DCC5.title: Pulsating Iron and Ender Pearls
moni.quest.27692C4A58F1A183.description1: Again, combining a few Components will make a Catalyst.
moni.quest.2794D9A3AD594F6A.description1: Break up your &6Amethyst Shards&r into &6Amethyst Dust&r.
moni.quest.27A80F018F59EF1E.description1: This one is decently slow to cook, so make sure to have it going constantly or stocked up.
moni.quest.27A80F018F59EF1E.description2: &6Signalum&r is noteworthy as the long-awaited next tier upgrade for your &bThermal Expansion&r machines and dynamos following "Reinforced" back in MV. It also conducts &dLuV&r voltage losslessly.
moni.quest.27A80F018F59EF1E.subtitle: Not glowing.
moni.quest.27A80F018F59EF1E.title: Signalum
moni.quest.27CE1D6B9683755F.description1: Note: this quest accepts LV/MV/HV Centrifuge.
moni.quest.27CE1D6B9683755F.description2: Centrifuging air is a reliable way to get &9Nitrogen&r before you have access to &3Cryogenic Distillation&r.
moni.quest.27CE1D6B9683755F.title: Air Centrifuging
moni.quest.27EBB5AAF8A40F3D.description1: You have become Death, destroyer of Universes.
moni.quest.27EBB5AAF8A40F3D.description2: This miner is your sole source of &6Hearts Of A Universe&r and &3Shattered Microverses&r.
moni.quest.27EBB5AAF8A40F3D.title: &9Tier Ten Microminer
moni.quest.27FAD6A8FCFAB543.description1: While LV Integrated Circuits might not seem easier to mass produce than &6Electronic Circuits&r, they allow for drastically cheaper MV circuits and they're required to produce the &6Advanced Integrated Circuit&r, your first &6HV&r circuit.
moni.quest.27FAD6A8FCFAB543.description2: Otherwise, they fulfill the same requirements.
moni.quest.27FAD6A8FCFAB543.title: &2The Second Tier One Circuits
moni.quest.281C7940CD437B69.description1: With your Rocket built and fuel loaded, it's time for the prelaunch checklist.
moni.quest.281C7940CD437B69.description2: - &eMake sure you're wearing your Space Suit&r (all four pieces) and that it has a full tank of Oxygen.
moni.quest.281C7940CD437B69.description3: - Two &aWaystones&r, with one set up to bring you back home.
moni.quest.281C7940CD437B69.description4: When you're sure you're prepared, sit in your rocket and press &eSpace&r.
moni.quest.281C7940CD437B69.title: &9Fly Me To The Moon
moni.quest.2823D7B4C8F900CA.description1: &6Stainless Steel&r will be your primary material for HV, in the same way that &6Aluminium&r was for MV and &2Steel&r was for LV.
moni.quest.2823D7B4C8F900CA.description2: &6Manganese&r comes from electrolyzing &6Tantalite&r, &6Pyrolusite&r, or &6Spessartine Dusts&r. You already have &6Chrome&r.
moni.quest.2823D7B4C8F900CA.description3: Mix up a bunch of the dust in a MV &3Mixer&r and begin processing it through the &3Electric Blast Furnace&r. This may be a good time to reevaluate your power generation and storage infrastructure.
moni.quest.2823D7B4C8F900CA.description4: You will need HV power to smelt this, which you can achieve with 2 MV Energy Hatches.
moni.quest.2823D7B4C8F900CA.title: Stainless Steel
moni.quest.28263004814F0F64.description1: &6Nichrome&r is the third coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 3600K so it can process more advanced materials.
moni.quest.28263004814F0F64.description2: Note that an &6HV&r &3Assembler&r is required to make them. &cEach tier of coil requires their tier of Assembler&r - we won't remind you again.
moni.quest.28263004814F0F64.description3: &93600K&r is now also hot enough to grant a single &9100%% efficient overclock&r to 1800K and below recipes. This means that one overclock will grant &94x speed&r instead of the normal &92x&r. In effect, you will get an additional 2x speed boost by overclocking once.
moni.quest.28263004814F0F64.description4: This means that the gas-boosted recipe for &6Aluminium&r will get cut from about &e7s&r to &e3s&r at HV. Once you upgrade your EBF to EV power, &6Stainless Steel Ingots&r will get cut from about &e37s&r to &e9s&r! It's well worth upgrading the EBFs producing these materials to &6Nichrome&r once you can afford it.
moni.quest.28263004814F0F64.description5: Later coils will give similar bonuses. Additionally, the EBF's temperature will increase by &9100K&r for each voltage tier above MV, which could make a difference for future materials.
moni.quest.28263004814F0F64.title: &2Nichrome Coil Blocks
moni.quest.2836DDEE49C3CCFB.description1: &2Upgraded forms of the EBF and Vacuum Freezer.&r
moni.quest.2836DDEE49C3CCFB.description2: Accepts any &6Parallel Control Hatch&r, parallelizing up to &e4096x&r with the best hatch!
moni.quest.2836DDEE49C3CCFB.description3: The &aRotary Hearth Furnace&r is quite big!
moni.quest.2836DDEE49C3CCFB.title: &2Upgraded EBF and Freezer
moni.quest.2845151447537433.description1: Expandable multi-block storage for RF power.
moni.quest.2845151447537433.description2: This first tier isn't much, but you can upgrade them over time to hold substantial amounts of power.
moni.quest.285052914EF655B9.description1: Combining a &6Printed Silicon&r, an &6LV Circuit&r, and one of the three types of &6Printed Circuits&r in an &3Inscriber&r will grant you a Processor. These are used in a wide variety of Applied Energistics blocks and items.
moni.quest.285052914EF655B9.title: Inscribing Processors
moni.quest.2859B3747ACF856C.title: Element 031: Gallium
moni.quest.2861BA7C235C52A3.description1: &eSuperconductor wires won't kill you when touched. In fact, you have to use Wires for Superconductors, because they don't even have cables!

&2There are an additional set of superconductors, one for each tier, which are the GTm default superconductors. Their advantage is their higher amperage rating, reaching the hundreds of amps for higher tier 16x wires. They are also used in crafting Field Generators. They are:
moni.quest.2861BA7C235C52A3.description2: &bEnder IO&r and &bThermal&r alloys are a bit more expensive than the normal wires, but they come with the huge advantage of being &2superconductors&r. Lossy cables like &6Tin&r and &6Copper&r will bleed out energy for every block they travel, but &2superconductors&r do not.
LuV - Indium Tin Barium Titanium Cuprate
UV - Enriched Naquadah Trinium Europium Duranide
moni.quest.2861BA7C235C52A3.description3: The &2cheap superconductors&r for each tier are:
moni.quest.2861BA7C235C52A3.title: &2Lossless Cables
moni.quest.28834638F1487312.title: Uranium Rhodium Dinaquadide
moni.quest.28834638F1487312.description1: &6Uranium Rhodium Dinaquadide&r is the second &cZPM&r superconductor, and is used to make the &3HPCA&r and &3Research Station&r.
moni.quest.28854E7AC91786E9.description2: You're not getting up to Resonant for a long time, just FYI.
moni.quest.28CA4E5308EC0BB9.description1: &6Naquadah&r is the sixth coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 7200K so it can process more advanced materials.
moni.quest.28CA4E5308EC0BB9.title: Naquadah Coil Blocks
moni.quest.28FE832435EAEE16.title: Element 077: Iridium
moni.quest.2923E98849358E16.description1: The &aAngel Ring&r is actually slower than a jetpack, but it grants creative flight and requires no fuel.
moni.quest.2923E98849358E16.description2: Up to you if you want to use it over a jetpack for day-to-day stuff, but it's an ingredient in each of the Jetplates so if you want either of them you'll need to make one eventually.
moni.quest.2923E98849358E16.subtitle: I'm running out of MCU puns.
moni.quest.2923E98849358E16.title: &9Captain… Marvel? IDK
moni.quest.293A7F5F0A58E5F3.title: Element 017: Chlorine
moni.quest.295E3D32083676E6.description1: &3Inscribers&r are machines used to make &6inscribed circuits&r for &bApplied Energistics&r.
moni.quest.295E3D32083676E6.description2: &9Inscribers can be set to automatically export items, can hold up to a stack of items within, as well as a variety of other features to aid in automation.
moni.quest.295E3D32083676E6.subtitle: Angry light forcing rocks to think
moni.quest.295E3D32083676E6.title: &9Inscribing
moni.quest.2977E1AF13E42DCB.description1: &2A bit of Vanadium Steel is used for progression. It's also a very strong tool material.
moni.quest.2977E1AF13E42DCB.title: &2Vanadium Steel
moni.quest.297B523B6C503957.description1: &rThe &3Steam Dynamos&r&r&r you have made are generating &aRF power&r, but &bGregTech&r machines require &aEU power&r. With your first &6circuit&r in hand, you are ready to build a &eLow Voltage (LV) &3&2Energy Converter&r.
With your first &6circuits&r in hand, you are ready to build a &eLow Voltage (LV) &3&2Turbine&r.
moni.quest.297B523B6C503957.description2: The &2Energy Converter&r is a special device that &econverts &2between &aRF power&r and &aEU power&r. They come in &2four sizes: 1A, 4A, 8A, and 16A.
Wires and cables are able to convert &aEU&r into &aRF&r at a &e1 to 4 ratio&r.
moni.quest.297B523B6C503957.description3: &aRF&r converts into &aEU&r at a &e4 to 1 ratio&r. &a100 RF&r becomes &a25 EU&r, and vice-versa. &2Use a Soft Hammer to change the conversion direction.
Machines that produce or consume EU will &cexplode&r if left out in the rain, so do be warned.
moni.quest.297B523B6C503957.description4: &eNote that you need an RF buffer to output into when you convert EU->RF!&r
moni.quest.297B523B6C503957.subtitle: Green = Input, Red = Output
moni.quest.297B523B6C503957.title: LV Power
moni.quest.29A487F0BC43AAF9.description1: &3Alloy Smelters&r are used to create alloys by melting and reforming items together.
moni.quest.29A487F0BC43AAF9.description2: Now you won't need to grind up metals into dusts and mix them for alloy dusts! Plus, many of the more complex alloys you couldn't make that way are now possible.
moni.quest.29A487F0BC43AAF9.title: Alloy Smelter
moni.quest.2A511DB40C66CF35.description1: This pack is in &eBeta&r. Issues are to be expected at this stage of development.
moni.quest.2A511DB40C66CF35.description3: Do note that a decent number of mods in this pack are also in alpha or beta as well, so before reporting an issue, make sure that the issue can not be replicated with the mod on its own, and if it can, report it to the mod's repository instead.
moni.quest.2A511DB40C66CF35.rich_descrip: If you find something broken/missing/etc, make an issue on the
, or submit a Pull Request to fix it yourself.
moni.quest.2A511DB40C66CF35.subtitle: Bleeding Edge!
moni.quest.2A511DB40C66CF35.title: &9This pack is in beta!
moni.quest.2A6E9E7C80754936.description1: With a &3Fusion Reactor&r, you can make Europium!
moni.quest.2A6E9E7C80754936.description2: This element is needed for making &9Sculk-related items&r, as well as the &6Fusion Reactor Computer MK II&r, &2Crystal Chip growing&r, and &6Wetware Supercomputers&r.
moni.quest.2A6E9E7C80754936.description3: You make it by fusing molten &6Neodymium&r and &6Hydrogen&r.
moni.quest.2A6E9E7C80754936.title: &2Europium Ingot
moni.quest.2A84013C14085C7B.description1: The &3Lathe&r is an important machine that makes &6Rods&r less expensive to craft. One ingot will yield two rods, doubling your output compared to manually crafting it.
moni.quest.2A84013C14085C7B.description2: In addition to this, it can also be used to craft &6Screws&r and &6Buzzsaw Blades&r.
moni.quest.2A84013C14085C7B.description3: You will need it later on to craft &6Lenses&r.
moni.quest.2A84013C14085C7B.title: Lathe
moni.quest.2AC61192BCD459F2.description1: &2Two Integrated Circuits&r and various other components will create a &2Good Integrated Circuit.
moni.quest.2AC61192BCD459F2.title: &2The Second Tier Two Circuits
moni.quest.2B336FD89B15F98E.description1: &2Rhodium Plated Lumium-Palladium is a mixture of Rhodium, Lumium and Palladium. It forms the basis of LuV Machine Hulls.
moni.quest.2B336FD89B15F98E.title: &2Rhodium Plated Lumium-Palladium
moni.quest.2B4F44E19AA7A1B6.description1: Smelt your &6Resonant Clathrate&r into &6Pulsating Dust&r. If you're using a &3Furnace&r to smelt it, it's more efficient to use the upgraded &3Furnaces&r, such as &3Iron Furnaces&r. You can fuel them with &6Sugar Cane&r. You might want to keep it as an &3Electric Furnace&r, depending on your circumstances.
moni.quest.2B7DEF68BB674CC6.title: Element 039: Yttrium
moni.quest.2BBAF93506DD79C1.description1: The &3Active Transformer&r is a device which can convert any number and type of &9GT Energy Inputs&r into any number and type of &9GT Energy Outputs&r. That includes &664A Substation Hatches&r, as well as &aLaser Hatches&r - refer to the nearby quests for more details on those.
moni.quest.2BBAF93506DD79C1.description2: With &9RF Cards&r and &3Energy Converters&r in this pack, this probably has limited use, but you can build it if you want. &2Notably, you can use an Active Transformer to interface with your Power Substation if you run out of hatch space.&r
moni.quest.2BBAF93506DD79C1.title: &2Active Transformer
moni.quest.2BCE3E3E0B8180F7.description1: In &bMV&r, you unlock new gasses that are cheaper to produce or last longer in your generators. In particular, &9Wood Gas&r, &9Benzene&r and &9LPG&r are good options at this stage. You'll likely need one of them, as &6Advanced Gas Turbine Generators&r consume 4x as much fuel to generate 4x as much &eEU&r.
moni.quest.2BD54071AD23C73C.description1: Making yourself a space suit is the most important step towards your space adventures.
moni.quest.2BD54071AD23C73C.description2: This suit lets you breathe in space, which is kind of important.
moni.quest.2BD54071AD23C73C.description3: If you wish, you can hide the spacesuit from your playermodel via the cosmetic armor buttons.
moni.quest.2BD54071AD23C73C.description4: Once your reach &9IV&r, you unlock the &6QuarkTech Armor set&r, which acts as an &bAd Astra&r Netherite Space Suit along with giving other benefits.
moni.quest.2BD54071AD23C73C.title: &9Space Suit
moni.quest.2C3C6D2038B01948.description1: The &3Multi Smelter&r is an absolute smelting unit, and is most likely the best furnace &9and alloy smelter&r added by a mod.
moni.quest.2C3C6D2038B01948.description2: It's a 3x3x3 multiblock machine capable of &esmelting huge amounts of items per second&r. By upgrading its coils and power tier, it can become capable of smelting up to literal thousands of items per second.
moni.quest.2C3C6D2038B01948.description3: Shift and hover over different coil blocks: they tell you the number of items a Multi Smelter can smelt per operation: &e32 items per level&r. The most basic Multi Smelter essentially does 32 items in the same time as a furnace does one. With a set of &9RTM Alloy&r coil blocks, that jumps to 128 items per operation.
moni.quest.2C3C6D2038B01948.description4: This quest doesn't ask for coils, hatches or buses: feel free to choose whatever combination you want. You'll need &a8 coil blocks&r, &a1 input bus&r, &a1 output bus&r, and &21 maintenance hatch&r, &21 muffler hatch&r, and at least &a1 energy hatch&r, all of any tier.
moni.quest.2C3C6D2038B01948.description5: &2The Multi Smelter can have its mode swapped between Electric Furnace and Alloy Smelter recipes by pressing the robot arm button in its GUI.&r For that reason, you'll probably want at least two of them eventually. Some other multiblocks use this mechanic as well.
moni.quest.2C3C6D2038B01948.title: &9Multi Smelter
moni.quest.2C4500569586EBC7.title: IV Energy Hatch
moni.quest.2C4500569586EBC7.description1: The &6Insane Voltage Coil&r required for this energy hatch will require an &9IV&r &3assembler&r and &6Neptunium&r.
moni.quest.2C4500569586EBC7.description2: You will also need &6HPIC Chips&r, requiring &6Indium&r and a &3cutter&r at &9IV&r tier.
moni.quest.2C4500569586EBC7.description3: Using two of these hatches, most multiblocks can be run at &dLuV&r voltage.
moni.quest.2C6BEB5BBE5A91DC.description1: &2With the MV Assembling Machine, you can assemble a few necessary parts for the next Circuit tier.
moni.quest.2C6BEB5BBE5A91DC.title: &2MV Assembling Machine
moni.quest.2C7306C74609E995.title: Spray Painting
moni.quest.2C7306C74609E995.subtitle: More than just colors!
moni.quest.2C7306C74609E995.description1: &6Empty Spray Cans&r can be filled with the liquid form of any color dye in a &3Canner&r. Once filled, they can dye any dye-able block (such as &6wool&r or &bAE2 &6cables&r) by simply right clicking. Cans alternatively can also be filled with solvent, causing them to un-dye clicked blocks.
moni.quest.2C7306C74609E995.description2: Hold shift when dyeing blocks to dye multiple connected blocks at once!
moni.quest.2C7306C74609E995.description3: In addition to dye-able blocks, &bGregTech&r &6wires&r, &6cables&r, &6machines&r, &6hatches&r and &6buses&r can be dyed.
moni.quest.2C7306C74609E995.description4: Importantly, dyed &bGT&r hatches/buses behave differently than when undyed. When dyed, they will share their contents with all other hatches/buses on the multi that are dyed the same color or undyed. Hatches/buses of different colors will not share contents. This can be quite helpful when you need to have separate 'groups' of hatches/buses on a multiblock, such as when dealing with different program circuits.
moni.quest.2C89DAD26E08E382.title: &9Leadstone Backpack
moni.quest.2CC50101A39EA2C0.description1: &6High-Octane Gasoline&r &2is an even more powerful combustion fuel, generating 3200 EU per mB of fuel. It can also be used in Cryolobus production, using 75%% less fuel than Cetane-Boosted Diesel or normal Gasoline. The trade-off is the very complex processing lines you must set up for it.&r
moni.quest.2CC50101A39EA2C0.description2: To refine Gasoline to High-Octane Gasoline, you will need:
moni.quest.2CC50101A39EA2C0.description8: To get the most out of this, run it in an Extreme Combustion Engine with Liquid Oxygen.
moni.quest.2CC50101A39EA2C0.title: &2High-Octane Gasoline
moni.quest.2D0DF78F71760F00.description1: Some Microminer missions use a &6Gemstone Sensor&r to scout out gems instead of ores, as well as other &6rare materials&r.
moni.quest.2D0DF78F71760F00.title: &9Gemstone Sensors
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description1: The &3Fusion Reactor&r is a multiblock that uses enormous amounts of energy to fuse fluids into new elements. This one is less flexible than the previous GregTech multiblocks, as you can only put hatches where the preview shows. &6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description2: The &bEMI&r preview shows &eall valid hatch locations&r, but you don't actually need that many fluid hatches. You can replace any of the hatch positions in the structure with &2Fusion Machine Casings&r as long as you have at least &atwo Fluid Input Hatches&r and &aone Fluid Output Hatch&r. It's possible to use input/output hatches in every valid location, if you prefer.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description3: Because of this, the quest only asks for &248 Fusion Machine Casings&r. If you want to use the minimum number of fluid hatches, you'll need to craft an additional &229 Fusion Machine Casings&r. In addition to the &a48 Fusion Machine Casings&r, you will also need &631 Fusion Glass&r or &631 Fusion Machine Casings&r. &bFusion Glass is cheaper, and looks cooler&r, but it's your choice.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description4: Each &aEnergy Hatch&r increases the reactor's power buffer. &cYou cannot use 4x or 16x Energy Hatches in Fusion Reactors. &aAll 16 Energy Hatches&r are required to be able to process all Mark 1 recipes and give a power buffer of &e160M EU&r. &2However, not all energy hatches need to be connected to power. For example, a recipe that requires LuV power draw would only need one or more hatches connected to power, but a recipe that needs ZPM power draw would need at least two hatches connected to power.&r &cThey still need to be present on the structure!&r
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description5: In addition to the recipe power drain, Fusion Reactors have a &eheat&r mechanic related to the recipe's &e"EU To Start"&r. This amount of power is drained from the reactor's buffer before starting the recipe to heat up the reactor to the necessary temperature, and is independent of the recipe's EU/t cost. As such, this determines the minimum tier of reactor you need for a recipe.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description6: If the reactor stops processing, it will &erapidly lose heat&r, even if you pause it with a soft hammer. On the other hand, if the reactor is already at the required temperature for a recipe, &eno additional power&r is required to heat up the reactor! This is true even if you switch between different recipes. This mechanic incentivizes continuous use of the reactor.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description7: If you switch to a recipe that requires more heat, &eonly the difference&r in heat values is consumed as EU to reach the target heat (up to a maximum heat equal to the reactor's current buffer).
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description8: Fusion Reactors &2overclock, but only once per fusion tier, instead of based on energy input.&r They gate the next tier of materials, so you will eventually want to make more than one.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.description9: On top of this, &9reactors get faster as they continuously run the same recipe.&r All recipes start out with &3double duration&r, but over time the recipes will eventually become &3twice as fast&r as listed in &bEMI&r.
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.subtitle: Time to get fusing!
moni.quest.2D10F2E538486624.title: &2Fusion Reactor MK I
moni.quest.2D31856F6EF1ED69.description1: Now that you have everything you need to power your machines, it's time to put it all together.
moni.quest.2D31856F6EF1ED69.description2: Your Steam Dynamo needs burnable fuel (like &6Coal&r) and &9water&r. It will output RF power through the Excitation Coil (the red bit at the top). The orientation of the Steam Dynamo can be adjusted with a &aCrescent Hammer&r if needed.

Your &6Steam Turbine&r needs &9Steam&r from your boilers. It will output EU power through the side with the dot. The orientation can be adjusted by &8Shift-Right-Clicking&r with a &aWrench&r, if needed.

Your Steam Dynamo needs burnable fuel (like &6Coal&r) and &9water&r. It will output RF power through the Excitation Coil (the red bit at the top). The orientation of the Steam Dynamo can be adjusted with a &aCrescent Hammer&r, if needed.
moni.quest.2D31856F6EF1ED69.description3: &6Energy cards&r can be used to transfer that RF power, but the dynamo can also output RF directly into an Energy Converter by making the Excitation Coil touch the Energy Converter. Alternately, the Converter can be skipped entirely by using &eGT Steam Turbines&r for power.
Now all you need are some &bGregTech&r machines to power up! You can make whatever you want, but its recommended that you get these two first:
moni.quest.2D31856F6EF1ED69.description4: The Energy Converter transforms RF power into EU, outputting the resulting EU through the side with a red dot. The orientation can be adjusted using a &aWrench&r. Attach your &6Conductive Iron Wires&r to the output side of the Energy Converter.
The &6Wiremill&r will make crafting wires much, much easier.
