moni.quest.4B338515E84FC51A.description5: - &3Alloy Smelter&r: Allows you to make &6Bronze&r more efficiently, as well as other useful alloys like &6Invar&r. Also allows you to cast &6Glass&r, and make components like &eGears&r more easily, and make &6Rubber Sheets&r, with Molds.

- &3Alloy Smelter&r: Allows you to make &6Bronze&r more efficiently, as well as other useful alloys like &6Invar&r. Also allows you to cast &6Glass&r, and make components like &eGears&r more easily, and make &6Rubber Sheets&r, with Molds.
moni.quest.4B338515E84FC51A.description6: You can upgrade them to HP version with Steel, which doubles their speed.
You can upgrade them to HP version with Steel, which doubles their speed.
moni.quest.4B338515E84FC51A.description7: If the machine sounds start to get on your nerves, you can mute GT machines with a GT Hammer.
If the machine sounds start to get on your nerves, you can mute GT machines with a GT Hammer.
moni.quest.4B43ABA024E9A0B9.description1: &eGlass&r is extremely useful, and will be used for many things in the future. Currently, you need it for the &cSteam Extractor&r, and can use it for &6Solar Boilers&r.
&eGlass&r is extremely useful, and will be used for many things in the future. Currently, you need it for the &cSteam Extractor&r, and can use it for &6Solar Boilers&r.
moni.quest.4B43ABA024E9A0B9.description2: Currently, your only available method to make Glass is through &eGlass Dust&r. Combine &eQuartz Sand&r with a &eTiny Pile of Flint Dust&r in a &3Crafting Table&r. Then, alloy it with the &eBlock Mold&r you have crafted, and voila!

Currently, your only available method to make Glass is through &eGlass Dust&r. Combine &eQuartz Sand&r with a &eTiny Pile of Flint Dust&r in a &3Crafting Table&r. Then, alloy it with the &eBlock Mold&r you have crafted, and voila!
moni.quest.4B43ABA024E9A0B9.description3: Later, to save you from this suffering, you can make an &6Arc Furnace&r, which makes two Glass, from one Sand.
Later, to save you from this suffering, you can make an &6Arc Furnace&r, which makes two Glass, from one Sand.
moni.quest.4B497D256FB3983F.description2: In this age, you will harvest a microverse whole, and put its &6heart&r to use creating endgame technologies such as the &6Stabilized Microminers&r and &6Prismatic Cores&r.
moni.quest.4B497D256FB3983F.title: &3UV&r Age
moni.quest.4BBB1F5A2657650D.title: Element 029: Copper
moni.quest.4BEC129D530376BF.description1: Crafting in a digital grid is heaven after using primitive wooden tables for so long.
moni.quest.4BEC129D530376BF.description2: It's a micropart, so you need to place it on an &6ME Cable&r.
moni.quest.4BEC129D530376BF.subtitle: Bye-bye Crafting Table
moni.quest.4BEC129D530376BF.title: Crafting Terminal
moni.quest.4C0BCA64D5B409F2.title: UEV Assembler
moni.quest.4C0BCA64D5B409F2.description1: The final assembler. You will need &6Optical Mainframes&r, &6Sculk Bioalloy&r, &6Necrosiderite&r, &6Hyperdegenerate Darconite&r, &6Infinity&r, and &6Null&r to make this.
moni.quest.4C0BCA64D5B409F2.description2: With this you can make &aUEV &6Energy Hatches&r, unlocking the &3Dimensonal Superassembler&r, &3Transdimensional Energy Singularity&r, and the most efficient recipe for &6Optical Circuits&r.
moni.quest.4C475D22CC95EB93.description1: You'll be needing large quantities of the various Noble Gases so you should get this automated and running continuously.
moni.quest.4C475D22CC95EB93.description2: &2After liquefaction, Overworld Air grants Helium and Argon; Nether Air grants Helium-3 and Neon; Ender Air grants Helium, Krypton, Xenon, and Radon.
moni.quest.4C475D22CC95EB93.description3: Certain Noble Gases (as well as Nitrogen) can also boost the speed of EBF processes.
moni.quest.4C475D22CC95EB93.title: &2Noble Gases
moni.quest.4C76017864258EA9.description1: &2Gasoline is a powerful combustion fuel, generating 1600 EU per mB of fluid. It can also be substituted for Cetane-Boosted Diesel in Cryolobus production.
moni.quest.4C76017864258EA9.description8: To get the most out of this, run it in an Extreme Combustion Engine with Liquid Oxygen.
moni.quest.4C76017864258EA9.title: &2Gasoline
moni.quest.4CC612FF64877C60.description1: As you continue to progress, crafting times for more advanced &3Electric Blast Furnace&r recipes will continue to increase. More advanced coils increase the operating temperature so you can smelt more advanced materials, &2and they also grant energy efficiency bonuses and speed bonuses to overclocking.&r
moni.quest.4CC612FF64877C60.description2: Despite this, you'll still need to get your infrastructure for smelting, as well as power generation, up to par.
moni.quest.4CC612FF64877C60.description3: You don't need to get all eight of these completed and running just yet, but plan to at some point in the future. Instead of upgrading existing EBFs, have them passively automating a stock of materials and build new EBFs with higher specifications for new materials.
moni.quest.4CC612FF64877C60.title: &2Blast Furnaces Galore
moni.quest.4CD6C60CBEFFA317.description1: &6Cupronickel Coils&r form part of the structure of a few multiblocks. Presently, those are the &3Electric Blast Furnace&r and &3Pyrolyse Oven&r. Each tier of coil unlocks new recipes and provides various bonuses to the multiblock they are attached to.
moni.quest.4CD6C60CBEFFA317.description2: Cupronickel Coils are produced in the &3Assembler&r with &62x Cupronickel Wire&r, &6Bronze Foil&r, and &9Liquid Tin Alloy&r.
moni.quest.4CD6C60CBEFFA317.description3: For now, you need 16 coils for the &3Electric Blast Furnace&r and 16 for the &3Pyrolyse Oven&r. That totals to 176 Copper, 128 Nickel, 32 Tin, and 16 Iron.
moni.quest.4CD6C60CBEFFA317.title: &2Cupronickel Coils
moni.quest.4CE0D6E9E7DE3129.title: Element 096: Curium
moni.quest.4D6AC14CAEEFC793.description1: Vanilla enchanting mechanics are just so tedious. Don't you wish you could just make a specific enchant instead of grinding levels and rolling the dice?
moni.quest.4D6AC14CAEEFC793.description3: The &3Dark Steel Enchanter&r is a device that uses &6Book and Quill&r, experience levels, lapis, and enchant-specific items to create an &6Enchanted Book&r with an enchantment of your choosing. Then you can just use an Anvil to enchant your item like usual.
moni.quest.4D6AC14CAEEFC793.description4: You can also make the &9Mending&r enchant which allows you to infinitely repair the item when damaged using &9Liquid XP&r in an &bEnder IO &aFluid Tank&r or &aPressurized Fluid Tank&r. Keep in mind that &9Mending&r does not work on &3Gregtech Tools&r.
moni.quest.4DB622A78605A2EB.description1: The first and most expensive Tier Six Circuit, needed for crafting the &9IV &3Circuit Assembler&r.
moni.quest.4DB622A78605A2EB.description2: Requires a bunch of standard circuit components.
moni.quest.4DB622A78605A2EB.title: The First Tier Six Ciruits
moni.quest.4DC7B2BB86A2FEBD.title: Element 056: Barium
moni.quest.4DCB58F9B3771DC8.title: Element 002: Helium
moni.quest.4E39FDB6FACDF522.title: Element 044: Ruthenium
moni.quest.4E4F03C44623A85D.description1: The &3Helical Fusion Reactor&r is a large multiblock structure capable of fusing elements in parallel&r. &9Unlike previous reactors, this one doesn't benefit from running the same recipe continuously.&r
moni.quest.4E4F03C44623A85D.description2: For every Hatch it has, its buffer increases by 80M EU, up to a maximum of 1280M.
moni.quest.4E4F03C44623A85D.description3: With the Helical you can now make &6Hyperdegenerate Matter&r, which is used in &6Hyperdegenerate Darconite&r and &6Naquadah Superfuel&r.
moni.quest.4E4F03C44623A85D.title: &9Helical Fusion Reactor
moni.quest.4E63CE9607E3B792.description1: With your &6Tungstensteel&r-based machine hulls and &6Nanoprocessor Mainframes&r squared away, you can finally get on the path to making an Insane Voltage &3Circuit Assembler&r.
moni.quest.4E63CE9607E3B792.description2: This tier of Circuit Assembler unlocks &6Quantum Circuits&r, as well as handling crafting recipes up to IV. It can also optionally overclock recipes that consume up to EV power for improved speed at the cost of relatively more power.
moni.quest.4E63CE9607E3B792.description3: Alternatively, you can make an &6IV Energy Hatch&r and use the &3Large Circuit Assembling Factory&r instead.
moni.quest.4E63CE9607E3B792.title: &2IV Circuit Assembler
moni.quest.4E9530E62A4B673B.description1:
Refines materials into potent &6Liquid Naquadah Fuels&r.

&2While you will need &6Crude Naquadah Fuel&2 in small amounts to send &6Tier Eleven Microminer&2 missions, Naquadah fuels are entirely optional beyond that.&r
moni.quest.4E9530E62A4B673B.title: &9Naquadah Fuel Refining
moni.quest.4EA1E0D437528747.description1: Combining an &6Active Prismatic Core&r with some &6Transcendental Matrix&r and &6Activated Netherite&r will grant you &6Infinity Ingots&r. Infinity is the the primary component of &aUEV&6 Hulls&r, but has many other uses throughout the end-game.
moni.quest.4EA1E0D437528747.description2: Instead of turning your Prismatic Cores into Infinity, you can instead convert them into &6Liquid Null&r. As the embodiment of sheer nothing-ness, it makes for a great cable coating sheet! And thus, it will be required for all &aUEV&r+ cables. Note that the amount of Null you get is far greater the more you process your Cores.
moni.quest.4EA1E0D437528747.subtitle: I bet we could make hulls out of these.
moni.quest.4EA1E0D437528747.title: &9Infinity and Null
moni.quest.4EAD8756BAAC6B2E.description1: If you don't want to mine Obsidian by hand, consider using a Fluid Solidifier to turn &cLava&r into &6Obsidian Blocks&r for you. The process is slow and energy intensive, though.
moni.quest.4EAD8756BAAC6B2E.description2: &3Fluid Solidifiers&r are useful for lots of other things too, of course. Look through the various molds to see what you can make with one.
moni.quest.4EAD8756BAAC6B2E.title: Fluid Solidifier
moni.quest.4EB9D1ADC4814330.description1: This is the first circuit that requires &6Polyethyl Cyanoacrylate&r, so go check that out if you haven't already.
moni.quest.4EB9D1ADC4814330.title: &9The Second Tier Nine Circuit
moni.quest.4EC59BC9BCCB3C5D.description1: &2With advanced alloys from the Alloy Blast Smelter and IV Machines, you can make large versions of most GT machines.
moni.quest.4EC59BC9BCCB3C5D.description2: &rThese are formed like multiblocks. You can add a &3Parallel Control Hatch&r in order to allow them to process &9more recipes&r at the same time. The highest tier of Parallel Control Hatch can facilitate processing &94096 recipes&r at once!
moni.quest.4EC59BC9BCCB3C5D.description3: &9Crafting Co-Processers increase the rate that your ME network will "push" batches of items out, perfect for machines like these.&r
moni.quest.4EC59BC9BCCB3C5D.description4: Look up the usages of Parallel Hatches in EMI to see details of all the multiblock machines.
moni.quest.4EC59BC9BCCB3C5D.description5: Most of the advanced alloys used to make the casings of these multiblocks are made in the &3Alloy Blast Smelter&r. If you can't seem to find the recipes for them, look for the &eMolten Fluid&r form.
moni.quest.4EC59BC9BCCB3C5D.title: &9Multiblock Madness
moni.quest.4EDE4D4D109BF2C2.title: Element 092: Uranium
moni.quest.4F08AF2C1E6B1736.title: MAX Energy Hatches
moni.quest.4F08AF2C1E6B1736.description1: With &6Monium&r and &6Extradimensional Mainframes&r, you can make &cMAX&r &6Energy Hatches&r. A 16A &cMAX&r hatch provides 256x the power compared to a &aUEV&r one, if you can supply it.
moni.quest.4F08AF2C1E6B1736.description2:
These hatches, along with the &3Transdimensional Energy Singularity&r and &6Omega Parallel Hatches&r, will allow you to scale your infrastructure to the insane levels needed to beat the pack.
&2The &6Creative Quantum Chest&2 costs over &ltwo hundred&r &6Extradimensional Processor Mainframes&2 and &lfive thousand&r &6Monium Ingots&2. You &lwill&r&2 need to use &6MAX hatches&2.&r
moni.quest.4F239316765C7CA1.description1: &9Item cards&r are useful for moving items between inventories over moderate distances.
moni.quest.4F239316765C7CA1.description2: Like with Fluid cards, these accept &6Logistics Overclockers&r to further increase throughput.
moni.quest.4F239316765C7CA1.title: &9Item Cards&r
moni.quest.4F4D0F44B615AF4C.description1: &2Sodium Persulfate and Iron III Chloride&r are used to make cheaper &9Good Circuit Boards&r, as it cuts the Silver amount by a factor of four. They are also &9required&r to make &9Plastic Circuit Boards&r, and circuit boards afterwards.
moni.quest.4F4D0F44B615AF4C.description2: Making &aSodium Persulfate&r with &6Salt&r will yield &aHydrochloric Acid&r as a coproduct, which you may re-use to make &aIron III Chloride&r. Alternatively, the &aHydrogen&r byproduct when making &aIron III Chloride&r can be recycled back into &aHydrochloric Acid&r in a closed loop, requiring only &aChlorine&r and &aIron&r as inputs. The decision is entirely yours as there is no single best approach as of now. With more automation later in the game, Iron III Chloride will be the cheaper and more straightforward path.
moni.quest.4F4D0F44B615AF4C.description3: Sodium Persulfate&r can also be used in &9Ore Processing&r in the &3Chemical Bath&r to get various bonus outputs you would not normally obtain. It is completely optional, but pretty rewarding.
moni.quest.4F4D0F44B615AF4C.subtitle: Iron The Third
moni.quest.4F4D0F44B615AF4C.title: &2Sodium Persulfate and Iron III Chloride
moni.quest.4F4F120AFB3A9250.description1: Now that you have &6Energetic Alloy&r, it's time to make some better cards!
moni.quest.4F4F120AFB3A9250.description2: Each time you upgrade your Cards, you'll also get more of them. Neat!
moni.quest.4F4F120AFB3A9250.description3: Make sure you're using an &3Assembling Machine&r to craft these things. Making them by hand isn't as efficient as the machine.
moni.quest.4F4F120AFB3A9250.title: Energetic Alloy Energy Cards
moni.quest.4F572CA3678CB287.description3: There are several ways to produce &6Quantum Flux&r. All are viable, so figure out which one works best for you.
moni.quest.4FABACAB7C4A74AC.description1: Use more &6Stem Cells&r and more advanced materials to build a &6Neuro Processing Unit&r. This is used in &6Wetware Processors&r.
moni.quest.4FABACAB7C4A74AC.title: &2Neuro Processing Unit
moni.quest.4FAFF184242F5EB8.description1: Run the plates through the respective &3Inscribers&r with &aPresses&r to make the printed plates, then combine the plates and circuit to form the Accumulation Processor.
moni.quest.4FAFF184242F5EB8.subtitle: &6Accumulation Processors&r are made from a &6Black Steel Plate&r, a &6Silicon Plate&r, and any tier three circuit.
moni.quest.4FAFF184242F5EB8.title: &9Accumlation Processors
moni.quest.4FE53F31E68F4C1C.description1: &9With EMI, instead of showing you a separate recipe for every tool-resource combination, tools are instead grouped. You can use any tool from that group - for example, the &6#forge:tools/hammers &9group means that any &aHammer &9can be used there.
moni.quest.4FE53F31E68F4C1C.description2: First, make a &aHammer&f (not a &aMining Hammer&f, mind you… six ingots, not plates). Hammers can be used to turn &etwo ingots into one plate&f. &6Plates&f can make a &aFile&f, Files can make &6Rods&f, etc. Use EMI to work your way down the list of tools.
moni.quest.4FE53F31E68F4C1C.description3: &6Wrought Iron&f is probably your best bet for a tool material right now, but better materials will become available as you progress.
&6Iron&f is probably your best bet for a tool material right now, but better materials will become available as you progress.
moni.quest.4FE53F31E68F4C1C.title: Some Starter Tools
moni.quest.4FF4697A8AF10731.title: ME Stocking Buses
moni.quest.4FF4697A8AF10731.description1: These blocks function similary to &6ME Input Buses&r/&6Hatches&r. Rather than specifying an amount to keep, the bus/hatch will make all items/fluid of that type in the network accessible to the multiblock. This does not actually pull the items from the network, so they are still available for use everywhere else in on the network.
moni.quest.4FF4697A8AF10731.description2: If the 'automatic pulling' mode is enabled, the first 16 items/fluid on the network will be made available to the multiblock.
moni.quest.500B77982B9CDF9B.title: Resonant Ender
moni.quest.500E619D568C07C2.description1: The Arc Furnace allows you to make &6Annealed Copper&r, which will be used in the MV Age. It can also make 2 pieces of Glass from 1 Sand. Later, it can make &2Tempered Glass&r for use in higher-tier recipes.
moni.quest.500E619D568C07C2.description2: The Arc Furnace also functions as a &auniversal recycling machine&r. Pretty much anything can be recycled into ingots and dusts of its base components.
moni.quest.500E619D568C07C2.description3: All of its recipes require Oxygen.
moni.quest.500E619D568C07C2.description4: Most Arc Furnace recipes use exactly 30 EU/t, so you can get a lot of mileage out of an LV one. However, many recipes take long enough that you may want to upgrade at some point.
moni.quest.500E619D568C07C2.title: &2Arc Furnace
moni.quest.502AB887CB316377.description1: The reaction that produces &9Bio Diesel&r is also the only source of &9Glycerol&r, which is an easy way to make &9Epichlorohydrin&r, an important ingredient of &9Epoxy&r.
moni.quest.502AB887CB316377.description2: &9Glycerol&r is also used in the production of &9Glyceryl Trinitrate&r, an important step in making &6Dynamite&r, which can be used later in the &3Implosion Compressor&r.
moni.quest.502AB887CB316377.description3: Even if you're otherwise going all in on petrochemistry for Epoxy, you'll probably end up with some Bio Diesel as a result of making Glycerol, unless you're using &6TNT&r.
moni.quest.502AB887CB316377.description4: Bio Diesel can be used for power, but it is probably better to convert it to &2Cetane-Boosted Diesel&r.
moni.quest.502AB887CB316377.title: Bio Diesel and Glycerol
moni.quest.503CA19637471E6E.title: &9Reinforced Backpack
moni.quest.5054D3FA7E96EB83.description1: These will be your first major use for &6Necrosiderite&r.
moni.quest.5054D3FA7E96EB83.title: &9Dimensional Processing Unit
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.description1: &bGregTech&r adds an &einteractive in-world preview&r for all &bGregTech&r multiblocks! &6Shift-right-click&r a placed controller &ewith an empty hand&r to activate a hologram depicting the default layout of the structure to help you with building. As you place blocks, the structure will be validated and the &efirst incorrect block&r it detects will be highlighted in red.
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.description2: &6Sneak-right-click&r to cycle from the full view through each layer. When on the final layer of the preview, this will remove the preview.
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.description3: &6Sneak-left-click&r to go back to the previous layer, or close the preview from the full view.
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.description4: In the &eJEI previews&r for multiblocks, &6left-click&r and drag the mouse to rotate the preview.
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.description5: Additionally, you can &6right-click&r and drag the mouse to pan the preview or &6shift-right-click&r and drag to zoom in or out.
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.description6: Some blocks in the multiblock preview have additional tooltips to provide more information on how the multiblock can form.
moni.quest.50591843C8501055.title: Multiblock Machine Previews
moni.quest.508452E1A3E09B56.description1: Overclocking aside, as you continue to progress in &5Monifactory&f, materials made in the &3Electric Blast Furnace&f will take longer to complete. &eMore advanced coils allow for the furnace to &eget hot enough to process more advanced materials&f, &2and they also grant energy efficiency bonuses and speed bonuses to overclocking.&r
moni.quest.508452E1A3E09B56.description2: Despite this, you'll still need to continually expand your smelting and power generation infrastructure.
moni.quest.508452E1A3E09B56.description3: You don't have to get all four of these Electric Blast Furnaces completed and running just yet, but be prepared to make many of them over the course of the pack.
moni.quest.508452E1A3E09B56.description4: &2As a reminder, all blocks and hatches can be shared across EBFs, except Maintenance!
moni.quest.508452E1A3E09B56.title: &2More Blast Furnaces
moni.quest.50FB5E0B0E0B142F.description1: You can make a net-positive &6Pulsating Prediction Matrix&r setup that uses &6Enderman Data Models&r to produce &6Ender Pearls&r. A Self-Aware &6Enderman Data Model&r can supply enough &6Ender Pearls&r to support the running of 6.2 other models.
moni.quest.517A89E954C7EA74.description1: An &3MV Electrolyzer&r allows you to process recipes that require up to 128 EU/t, and can optionally overclock recipes costing at most 32 EU/t.
moni.quest.517A89E954C7EA74.description2: This means you can split more kinds of things for useful products.
moni.quest.519389755420A7A8.description1:
&9Glue&r can be centrifuged from &6Sticky Resin&r. This is the simplest recipe for the stuff, and the cheapest unless you have a surplus of certain chemicals.

&9Glue&r itself has several applications, most of which are &3Assembler&r counterparts to recipes performed in a &3Crafting Table&r.
moni.quest.5199E6FAA4B699CD.title: LuV Power Storage
moni.quest.519A11FDC6A7EF21.description1: Circuits along this line are UV, and can all be substituted in recipes.
moni.quest.519A11FDC6A7EF21.title: UV Circuits
moni.quest.51A463024F35DC2E.description1: This is the next tier of polymer. It is used in crafting &6Advanced SMD components&r and &cZPM&r &6Machine Hulls&r, among other things.
moni.quest.51A463024F35DC2E.description2: This polymer can require up to &914 steps&r to create from scratch, but multiple steps are able to be skipped through distillation of various liquids. &6Check what steps you can easily skip!&r
moni.quest.51A463024F35DC2E.title: &2Polybenzimidazole (PBI)
moni.quest.51F895647CB242F1.description2: Or you can heat &9Acetone&r, or a few other approaches. Check out &bEMI&r for the various options.
moni.quest.51F895647CB242F1.title: Ethenone
moni.quest.51FD757E07E397A1.description1: The &3Simulation Supercomputer&r functions identically to the &3Simulation Chamber&r, but can be overclocked with energy hatches to run faster with more energy. This multiblock can be useful if your resource generation has started lagging behind since unlocking &bHNN&r.
moni.quest.521977C7165229F1.description1: Now you can craft the &6Quantum Processor Mainframe&r, the first Tier Seven circuit.
moni.quest.521977C7165229F1.description2: These are required for crafting the Ludicrous Voltage (LuV) &3Circuit Assembler&r.
moni.quest.521977C7165229F1.title: &2The First Tier Seven Circuits
moni.quest.527F56DFAD5E20EC.description1: &6Gregtech Axes&9 are able to veinmine an entire tree at once!
moni.quest.527F56DFAD5E20EC.title: &9Tree chopping
moni.quest.52837FD72580F141.description1: With ten slots for Storage Cells, you can store a huge number of items inside this single block, and search through them all with a &6Terminal&r. You just gotta make all those Storage Cells.
moni.quest.52837FD72580F141.description2: If you somehow run out of room, you can make another ME Drive for even more slots! So many cells, so many items!
moni.quest.52837FD72580F141.subtitle: *Slaps &6ME Drive&r* this bad boy can fit so many &6Storage Cells&r in it!
moni.quest.52837FD72580F141.title: Digital Storage For Days
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.description1: This pack has &aSnad&r, which is simply a sand-like block that instantly grows sugar cane/cactus on top of it when it receives either a block update or a redstone update.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.description2: The sugar cane it produces can be used as a fuel for your dynamos, and later you can even brew it for &9Biomass&r.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.description3: This quest calls for a &aRedstone Clock&r because it grows Snad even on the fastest setting - vanilla Observer clocks pulse too quickly.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.description4: To collect the sugar cane, you can use a piston and an observer.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.description5: For now, a &3Vacuum Chest&r should help keep the floor clean, and causes less lag than Hoppers. A &aVoid Upgrade&r in a &6Storage Drawer&r will automatically delete any items that overflow the drawer's capacity, so it's a good way to ensure you don't crash your server from accumulating a massive sugar cane pile.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.rich_descrip: If the noises are annoying to you, take a look at
quest to see how to mute them.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.subtitle: Yes, Snad.
moni.quest.529D50CE814AF449.title: Snad
moni.quest.52B20235882063BF.description1: Combine several components into a catalyst.
moni.quest.52F1953ED72A8AA6.description1: The &3Advanced Microverse Projector&r is a more powerful projector required for sending &6Tier Four&r through &6Tier Six Microminers&r into microverses.
moni.quest.52F1953ED72A8AA6.description2: Additionally, for each tier of projector you use above the required tier of a recipe, you will get a free perfect overclock, similar to how &3EBF&rs grant perfect overclocks with temperature.
moni.quest.52F1953ED72A8AA6.description3: This tier requires &6EV Field Generators&r, and therefore &6Uranium&r. You can get some from processing &6Uraninite&r.
moni.quest.52F1953ED72A8AA6.description4: Initial missions can operate on &eIV power&r, while &eLuV power&r is required for later missions. As with the prior projector, this structure supports overclocking and the position of buses and hatches can be swapped with any &6Microverse Projector Casing&r.
moni.quest.52F1953ED72A8AA6.description5: &6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
moni.quest.52F1953ED72A8AA6.title: Advanced Microverse Projector
moni.quest.5301E546BAA69844.description1: You might want to save your &6Coal Dust&r for circuits and use &6Charcoal Dust&r instead. Later, you can also process either &6Coal Coke Dust&r or &2Diamond Dust&r into &6Carbon Dust&r, which can be used for other alloys.
moni.quest.5301E546BAA69844.subtitle: You already have &6Steel&r, but it can be made faster in the &3Alloy Smelter&r, at the cost of EU.
moni.quest.5301E546BAA69844.title: &9Alloying Steel
moni.quest.53205E306EE07F6F.description1: Cards to carry even MORE RF power.
moni.quest.53205E306EE07F6F.description2: You're making these in an &3Assembling Machine&r, right?
moni.quest.53205E306EE07F6F.title: Vibrant Alloy Energy Cards
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description1: &2Initial circuit components can be complex in GTm, as you need both Arsenic and Gallium.&r
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description2: For &9Gallium&r, you may, ranked from worst to best:
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description3: - &3Electrolyze &aSphalerite&r for a low chance of small dust. Note that you lose on direct smelting value.
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description4: -&r Put &aCrushed Bauxite&r in the &3Chemical Bath&r. Note that this requires &9Sodium Persulfate&r.
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description5: - Obtain it as a Byproduct of &aSphalerite&r Ore Processing, in the &3Thermal Centrifuge&r or &3Centrifuge&r.
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description6: &2For Arsenic, you must centrifuge Realgar Dust, or (more involvedly) flash smelt Cobaltite Dust in the EBF, and electrolyse the resultant Arsenic Trioxide.
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.description7: Combine both in a Mixer to make Gallium Arsenide.
moni.quest.53347AAAE4495F95.title: &2Gallium Arsenide
moni.quest.5357A16B5BF62C96.description2: It might seem crazy right now, but you'll want a dedicated &3Chemical Reactor&r for a large fraction of the chemicals you want to process. You probably want to hold off on doing that until you've got a solid base with autocrafting though… it stings a lot less when you can just request crafts of Chemical Reactors from your AE2 system. Additionally, &3Large Chemical Reactors&r are easier to upgrade in the future.
moni.quest.5357A16B5BF62C96.title: MV Chemical Reactor
moni.quest.536CEDA3142BCE63.description1: Circuits along this line are LuV, and can all be substituted in recipes.
moni.quest.536CEDA3142BCE63.description2: The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in larger quantities and is overall easier to produce.
moni.quest.536CEDA3142BCE63.description3: Make sure to set up wetware board production as soon as possible! They take a very long time to make.
moni.quest.536CEDA3142BCE63.title: LuV Circuits
moni.quest.53C00EA9D9BEE776.description1: The Second Microminer! If this is your first microminer, please read the quests about how microminers and microverses work in the
moni.quest.53C00EA9D9BEE776.description2: &2You'll need Phosphorous in its LV Field Generators&r.
moni.quest.53C00EA9D9BEE776.description3: This Miner is a good source of &6Tungsten and Noble Gases&r, among other things.
moni.quest.53C00EA9D9BEE776.description4: &9Don't forget that you can automate Extended Crafting recipes before you get PackagedAuto by converting your Extended Crafting tables into autocrafting tables.
moni.quest.53C00EA9D9BEE776.title: &9Tier Two Microminer
moni.quest.53EC3831D66769CA.description2: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r or &3Alloy Blast Smelter&r and cooled in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r.
moni.quest.53EC3831D66769CA.title: High Speed Steel Type G
moni.quest.542F0090D8975D3C.description1: In &9Monifactory&r, all dimensional transit is done through the power of &6TelePastries&r. No Portals here!
moni.quest.542F0090D8975D3C.description2: This quest is repeatable and gives you a free cake to the &2Overworld&r or &7Void World&r every hour. You can also refill your cakes with the items indicated in their tooltips.
moni.quest.542F0090D8975D3C.description3: &cDon't forget to have a way to get back!&r If you do forget, click on the Emergency Items heart on the right side of the quest book screen.
moni.quest.542F0090D8975D3C.subtitle: Cakes are quantum objects!
moni.quest.542F0090D8975D3C.title: Cake Based Dimensional Transit
moni.quest.5430ED88A8D10502.description1: You might want to get yourself an anvil instead of breaking and crafting new tools every time. Anvils&f spawn abundantly in &bLost Cities&f buildings, so go and snatch one!
moni.quest.5430ED88A8D10502.description2: Put a damaged tool and some material it's made of inside. For example, you'll need to use &6Wrought Iron Ingots&f to repair tools made of &6Wrought Iron&f. The only tools unable to be repaired are the Mortar and the Plunger.

Put a damaged tool inside and put some material it's made of. For example, you'll need to put &6Iron Ingots&f to repair tools made of &6Iron&f. The only tools unable to be repaired are the mortar and the plunger.

Put a damaged tool inside and put some material it's made of. For example, you'll need to put &6Wrought Iron Ingots&f to repair tools made of &6Wrought Iron&f. The only tools unable to be repaired are the mortar and the plunger.
moni.quest.5430ED88A8D10502.description3: Also, you can now repair your free &6Mining Hammers&r with some &6Diamonds&r!
moni.quest.5430ED88A8D10502.subtitle: &3Anvils&f can be used to repair almost all &bGregTech tools&f!
moni.quest.5430ED88A8D10502.title: Proper Tool Care
moni.quest.544E87F5E356FE10.description1: &6Nichrome&r is the third coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 3600K so it can process more advanced materials.
moni.quest.544E87F5E356FE10.description2: Notice that an &6HV&r &3Assembler&r is required to make them. Each tier of coil requires their tier of Assembler - we won't remind you again.
moni.quest.544E87F5E356FE10.description3: &93600K&r is now also hot enough to grant a single &9100%% efficient overclock&r to 1800K and below recipes. This means that one overclock will grant &94x speed&r instead of the normal &92x&r. In effect, you will get an additional 2x speed boost by overclocking once.
moni.quest.544E87F5E356FE10.description4: This means that the gas-boosted recipe for &6Aluminium&r will get cut from about &e7s&r to &e3s&r at HV. Once you upgrade your EBF to EV power, &6Stainless Steel Ingots&r will get cut from about &e37s&r to &e9s&r! It's well worth upgrading the EBFs producing these materials to &6Nichrome&r once you can afford it.
moni.quest.544E87F5E356FE10.description5: Later coils will give similar bonuses. Additionally, the EBF's temperature will increase by &9100K&r for each voltage tier above MV, which could make a difference for future materials.
moni.quest.544E87F5E356FE10.title: &2Nichrome Coil Blocks
moni.quest.545CCC24D9401794.description1: Using plain &3Steam Dynamos&f is pretty inefficient.
moni.quest.545CCC24D9401794.description2: It's strongly recommended to upgrade your Dynamos into &3Steam Boilers&f and &3Steam Turbines&f. The ratio is always &a1:2&r if all machines are equally upgraded.
moni.quest.545CCC24D9401794.description3: This greatly increases the overall efficiency and the amount of power produced, from &a40 RF/t&r per basic steam dynamo to &a320 RF/t&r per set of three augmented machines.
moni.quest.545CCC24D9401794.title: Boilers and Turbines
moni.quest.54B7849F647CE74B.description1: The &6IPMEPS&r is capable of altering the laws of physics on a microversal scale, thus allowing the production of previously &9impossible materials&r.
moni.quest.54B7849F647CE74B.subtitle: The final Microminer!
moni.quest.54B7849F647CE74B.title: &9Tier Twelve Microminer
moni.quest.54C3B1B782FDF57F.subtitle: Glowing!
moni.quest.54C3B1B782FDF57F.description1: &6Lumium&r is used to make wires that transmit IV power losslessly, and it is part of the alloy needed for &dLuV &6Machine Hulls&r. You will also need some Lumium to make &6Nanoprocessor Supercomputers&r.
moni.quest.54C3B1B782FDF57F.title: Lumium
moni.quest.55074143B559493F.description1: Having unlocked &6Signalum&r, at long last you can make &aSignalum Integral Components&r!
moni.quest.55074143B559493F.description2: Dynamos operate at &a500%% of base power generation and fuel burn rate&r.
moni.quest.55074143B559493F.description3: Machines operate at &a500%% of base speed&r.
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.description1: Firstly, you will need a &3Matter Condenser&r. Stick a &664k ME Storage Component&r in, change the mode to 'Singularity', and stuff lots of items (or fluids) in, &9done easily with an infinity cell&r.
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.description2: If you don't have that, you can provide it with the output of regular &6Water&r or &6Cobblestone&r generation methods.
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.description3: After you have made the &eSingularity&r you will need from the &3Matter Condenser&r, you need to set up a &aQuantum Ring Multiblock&r. Build a 3 by 3 vertical ring with your &6Quantum Rings&r, leaving a hole in the middle. Finally, stick your &6Quantum Link Chamber&r in the hole, and connect it to your ME system. If you built it correctly, the textures of the rings should combine, leaving you with a &aMultiblock&r.
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.description4: Next, create a pair of &eQuantum Entangled Singularities&r by throwing Ender Dust and a Singularity into the vicinity of an explosion.
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.description5: &9Now that you have Quantum Entangled Singularities, put one into the&r &6Quantum Link Chamber&r&9 of the &r&aQuantum Ring&r&9, and the other in the dedicated slot of the &6Wireless Terminal&9!&r
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.description6: You should be good to go! You can now access AE2 anywhere, including in different dimensions!
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.subtitle: Accessing AE2 from anywhere is a bit more expensive and complex, but it's well worth the effort.
moni.quest.553F85782265C350.title: &9AE2 Everywhere!
moni.quest.5543D84CB5E37E01.description1: &aMV Batteries&r function essentially the same as &aLV Batteries&r, only stronger. They also need to be put into &3MV Machines, MV Battery Buffers&r or &3MV Turbo Chargers&r.
moni.quest.5543D84CB5E37E01.title: MV Power Storage
moni.quest.555BEBF7FD6012B7.description1: This is an even larger Extended Crafting Table, capable of handling 9x9 recipes.
moni.quest.555BEBF7FD6012B7.title: &9Ultimate Crafting Table
moni.quest.5560E43D1B773B93.description1: Raw Rubber can be &3Centrifuged&r from &6Sticky Resin&r, but if you're not after &9Glue&r or &6Plant Balls&r then the &3Extractor&r is faster.
moni.quest.5567F5E5926664F4.description1: A hefty amount of &6Silicon Dust&r and a pinch of &2Gallium Arsenide &rcooked in an &3EBF&r will net you a &6Silicon Boule&r, the starting point for &6Circuit Wafers&r.
moni.quest.5567F5E5926664F4.description2: Make sure your power system is up to the task. These take &27.5 minutes and 1,080,000 EU&r to process.
moni.quest.5567F5E5926664F4.title: &2Silicon Boules
moni.quest.5601A05D8361551D.description1:
Assembling &6Optical Circuitry&r inside Microverse shards is quite tricky and inconsistent, but pulling it off is the key to assembling the perfect circuit, the &6Extradimensional Processor Mainframe&r.
&6Optical Extradimensional CPU Cores&2 are very delicate and have a chance to fail entirely, so you'll have to get creative automating those.&r
moni.quest.5601A05D8361551D.description2: &6Extradimensional Processor Mainframes&r are unique in that there are no subsquent circuit themes, and thus no other kinds of Tier Eleven circuits.
moni.quest.5601A05D8361551D.subtitle: The Final Circuit!
moni.quest.5601A05D8361551D.title: &9The First (And Only) Tier Eleven Circuit
moni.quest.5672773780EE8267.description1: &2You can start to churn out Nanoprocessors&r. These are the best kind of Tier Three circuits you can make, and you won't unlock the better recipes for them until &dLuV&r.
moni.quest.5672773780EE8267.description2: You should absolutely automate the production of these circuits, and &ekeep a stockpile automatically crafted&r so you don't have to wait around for them or bloat your crafting orders making them on-demand through AE.
moni.quest.5672773780EE8267.title: &2The Third And Final Tier Three Circuits
moni.quest.56924FC6B029BA0F.description1: When making circuits, you'll need either &9Liquid Tin&r, or &9Liquid Soldering Alloy&r&r&r. &2Soldering Alloy is made in the Mixer with 6 parts Tin Dust, 3 parts Lead Dust and 1 part Antimony Dust.&r You then process it in an &3Extractor &rfor the usual 144mB of fluid per unit.
moni.quest.56924FC6B029BA0F.description2: The &2Circuit Assembler&r will only consume half as much Soldering Alloy as it would have consumed Liquid Tin per craft (72mB vs 144mB), so it's very efficient to use this stuff.
moni.quest.56924FC6B029BA0F.description3: &2Antimony can be directly smelted from Stibnite Ore, allowing you to skip ore processing for this.
moni.quest.56924FC6B029BA0F.title: Soldering Alloy
moni.quest.56BAC68878E11DF4.description1: A common component used by &bExtended Crafting&r.
moni.quest.5D1DAC23C6B89AC4.title: Element 083: Bismuth
moni.quest.56F6AFFFCAE8A5D4.title: Element 082: Lead
moni.quest.56FB624B384FFAF5.description1: You may have noticed that The End portals in Strongholds are disabled.
moni.quest.56FB624B384FFAF5.description2: The only way to access The End is… to &ebake a cake&r. You can refill it with &6Eyes of Ender&r.
moni.quest.56FB624B384FFAF5.description3: Prepare some gear, eat a slice, and get ready for a fight!
moni.quest.56FB624B384FFAF5.title: The End…?
moni.quest.5732018AA35D69B6.description1: The &3Elite Assembler&r is required for &6Advanced SMD components&r and &6HSS-G Coils&r.
moni.quest.5732018AA35D69B6.description2: Consider upgrading to a &6Large Assembling Factory&r, which is easier to upgrade and can accept Parallel Control Hatches.
moni.quest.5732018AA35D69B6.title: &2IV Assembler
moni.quest.5759E8587624BEF1.description1: Marginally cheaper to make than &2Advanced Integrated Circuits&r, and also the only way to make the &2Microprocessor Supercomputer&r, which is the first Tier Four circuit.
moni.quest.5759E8587624BEF1.title: &2The Second Tier Three Circuits
moni.quest.5792330C6E5B87A3.description2: &6Naquadria&o&r is used in the construction of &6UV components&r, the &3Fusion Reactor MK II&r, and in cracking &6Naquadah Fuel&r products.
moni.quest.5792330C6E5B87A3.title: &2Naquadria
moni.quest.5795EE147D4879B7.description2: However, this machine will still see use for compressing &eNuggets&r into&e Ingots&r, &eIngots&r into &eBlocks&r, &eGem Dusts&r into &ePlates&r (such as &6Certus Quartz&r), as well as various other useful recipes.
moni.quest.5795EE147D4879B7.title: &2Compressor
moni.quest.57A6FE885489C3ED.description1: A &6Reinforced Epoxy Resin Sheet&r is made in a &3Chemical Bath&r, not a &3Chemical Reactor&r. The board itself is made in a Chemical Reactor though.
moni.quest.57A6FE885489C3ED.description2: Other than that, it's very similar to the other substrates you've made so far. This board type unlocks &2Quantum Circuits, which span tiers four through seven.
moni.quest.57A6FE885489C3ED.title: Fiber-Reinforced Printed Circuit Board
moni.quest.57AB012919A985A2.title: debug: undo em
moni.quest.7ABC7057BC2E8CE4.title: Oxalic Acid
moni.quest.7ABC7057BC2E8CE4.description1: Like &9Sodium Persulfate&r and &9Iron III Chloride&r before it, &9Oxalic Acid&r is used as an etchant for &6Circuit Boards&r.
moni.quest.7ABC7057BC2E8CE4.description2: Unlike the previous etchants, &9Oxalic Acid&r won't be necessary until &5EV&r, where it is used in certain processing lines like &aCoal Fly Ash Processing&r for Germanium.
moni.quest.57AE5794C23B5B6F.title: Element 093: Neptunium
moni.quest.57C389A59CA5E00F.description1: With a &3Pyrolyse Oven&r, you can bake &6Logs&r for &9Charcoal Byproducts&r or any of its distillates. Once you hit &6HV&r, these can be further distilled and processed into useful chemicals like &9Toluene&r, &9Phenol&r, &9Benzene&r, &9Methanol&r, &9Acetone&r, &9Acetic Acid&r, and others.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description1: The &3Data Bank&r acts as a mass storage for &6Data Sticks&r and &6Data Orbs&r. It is also required for reading &6Data Modules&r.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description2: Connect an &3Optical Data Transmission Hatch&r on the Data Bank to an &3Optical Data Reception Hatch&r (replacing the &3Data Access Hatch&r) on your &3Assembly Line&r using &aOptical Cables&r, and it will be able to read the data of all data items within the Data Bank.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description3: You can connect multiple &3Assembly Lines&r to a single Data Bank, but each one will need its own &3Transmission Hatch&r on the Data Bank.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description4: &3Data Access Hatches&r and &3Optical Hatches&r can replace any of the &aComputer Casings&r in the structure, but it must have a minimum of &e3&r &aComputer Casings&r. Each &3Data Access Hatch&r and &3Optical Hatch&r within the structure will consume &d1,920 EU/t&r regardless of their usage.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description5: You will also need a &aMaintenance&r and &aEnergy Hatch&r, which can replace the &aHigh Power Casings&r in front.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description6: Although this is not strictly required until you need to make and read &6Data Modules&r, your single &3Data Access Hatch&r on your &3Assembly Line&r will not have space to hold all the items you need to craft otherwise.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.description7: If your Assembly Line setups grow enough, you may need to &echain&r Data Banks. Connect the &3Transmission Hatch&r on the Data Bank with data to the &3Reception Hatch&r of a second Data Bank. The &ereceiving&r Data Bank will be able to read all the data within the transmitting Data Bank, and can send that data to more Assembly Lines or more Data Banks. However, this comes at a greatly increased energy cost for the transmitting Data Bank.
moni.quest.57C75A5756F62D17.title: &2Data Bank
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.description1: For now, the best material to make these pipes out of is probably &6Tin&r.
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.description2: Their advantage over &bLaserIO&r &3Laser Nodes&r is their far higher &6throughput&r. An unupgraded LaserIO Item Card transports &98 items per second&r, and up to &964 per tick&r when upgraded. In comparison, small low-tier Item Pipes can transfer &964 items per second&r, and those made from later materials can transfer &9multiple stacks per second&r.
Small low-tier Item Pipes can transfer &964 items per second&r, and those made from later materials can transfer &9multiple stacks per second&r.
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.description3: They don't auto-extract by themselves, so you have to use &3Conveyor Covers&r etc. with them.
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.description4: The priority mechanics are as follows:
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.description5: A Destination will have a Routing Value calculated, which is the sum of all Routing Values of the individual Pipes to that Destination. Whichever Destination has the lowest Routing Value will be the one selected for Insertion.
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.description6: Restrictive Pipes typically have the lowest Priority for insertion due to their higher Routing Value.
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.subtitle: &2GT Item Pipes will transport items instantly through them and accept GT covers.
moni.quest.57D1B1D74391A05F.title: &2GT Item Pipes
moni.quest.57D410C5A9EAFAD9.description1: Crush your &6Obsidian&r into &6Obsidian Dust&r. You'll need a lot of this for &6Petrotheum Dust&r.
moni.quest.57D9FA04817CB92F.description1: A complex plating material used to assemble the Tier Nine Microminer.
moni.quest.57D9FA04817CB92F.title: Quantum Fluxed Eternium Heavy Plating
moni.quest.57E7182198B2EA9A.subtitle: unlocks nm only quests
moni.quest.57E7182198B2EA9A.title: &eNormal Mode
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.description1: &6Gregtech&r adds a decent bit of extra crafting to the earlygame. Thankfully, &bEMI&r has some tools to help make your life &9&lMUCH&r easier when doing all this crafting.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.description3: When looking a recipe in EMI, you've likely noticed 3 buttons that appear on each recipe, being &c[❤]&r, &a[┴]&r, and &9[+]&r.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.description4: Let's start with &9[+]&r, as it's the simplest: right-click a crafting table, look up the recipe you need and press the &9[+]&r button: if you have all required items for the recipe, this will put them all into the crafting table for you.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.description5: &c[❤]&r and &a[┴]&r are used in tandem to create &arecipe trees&r. Pressing &a[┴]&r will pull up a &arecipe tree&r for that given item. Pressing &c[❤]&r on a recipe will mark it as the &cdefault recipe&r for that item, and will show that recipe (and the items used to craft it) in &arecipe trees&r. You can then add &cdefault recipes&r for the items used to craft that recipe, repeat ad nauseam. Note that you can click on a item in the &arecipe tree&r and its recipes will be pulled up.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.description6: In the &arecipe tree&r GUI, you can change the batch size by scrolling on the number to the right of the final result. Finally, and most importantly, you can press the &6Magnifying Glass&r to switch to &6Crafting Tree Mode&r, this will &edisplay the items that you need for every step to craft the number of items that you specified&r in your sidebar, and will dynamically update as you craft items. You can click on these &6Synthetic Favorites&r with your Craft to Inventory bind (unbound by default) to &eautomatically craft and then push items back into your inventory&r when using a crafting table, or push the exact number of items needed if using a different inventory.&r
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.description7: Also note that EMI will commit &cdefault recipes&r to memory, meaning that as you save more and more recipes, EMI will remember them all, and will automatically use them when you pull up a &arecipe tree&r for any given item. Also, you can change the &cdefault recipe&r for an item, and EMI will automatically update the &arecipe tree&r as well. You can also click the &a[┴]&r button found in the bottom left of your inventory screen and it will pull up the &arecipe tree&r GUI as well.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.rich_descrip: On the topic of crafting, if you are not already familiar with how
like EMI or JEI work, read that quest first.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.subtitle: Better than any crafting calculator.
moni.quest.58566C7BF4C22D86.title: &9Recipe Trees and Crafting Trees
moni.quest.5878D53EB85F3881.description1: &9Oxygen&r, &9Hydrogen&r, and &6Carbon&r combine together in a &3Chemical Reactor&r to make &9Methanol&r.
moni.quest.5878D53EB85F3881.title: Methanol
moni.quest.588048A00A6250FB.description1: &6Luminessence&r is used in a number of things beyond just Extended Crafting Tables, such as Nether Stars.
moni.quest.58A9F4F2BEDB1B96.description1: &rBPA can be produced using petrochemistry distillation products, or via distilling &9Charcoal Byproducts&r from your &3Pyrolyse Oven&r into useful components. Alternatively, you can get &9Phenol&r from &6Coal&r pyrolysis. &9Fermented Biomass&r is also useful to distill as it provides many useful products.
moni.quest.58A9F4F2BEDB1B96.description2: &2Using the Large Chemical Reactor, you can skip two steps in the Epoxy production line.
moni.quest.58A9F4F2BEDB1B96.title: &2Epoxy Production
moni.quest.58F73E3D1069F52C.description1: The &aME Extended Drive&r can store up to 20 Storage Cells.
moni.quest.58F73E3D1069F52C.subtitle: Dense Storage
moni.quest.58F73E3D1069F52C.title: &9ME Extended Drive
moni.quest.58FCAC329B09FEB0.description1: &9Elemental Reduction Fluid&r is the main method of early &6Thermal Elemental Dust&r production in Hardmode, but can also see some use in Normal Mode.
moni.quest.58FCAC329B09FEB0.title: Elemental Reduction Fluid
moni.quest.5911900438648430.description1: As the most advanced polymer you will need to make, &6Polyethyl Cyanoacrylate&r is required for a few endgame crafts.
moni.quest.5911900438648430.description2: It's a little different from previous polymers, but you'll be fine.
moni.quest.5911900438648430.subtitle: Krazy Glue
moni.quest.5911900438648430.title: Polyethyl Cyanoacrylate
moni.quest.591A1B8B279DFCC9.description1: &6Diodes&r are a component in the next Circuit tiers. They are made in an &3Assembler&r from liquid &9Glass&r, &6Fine Copper Wire&r and &6Gallium Arsenide&r.
moni.quest.591A1B8B279DFCC9.description2: Always be on the lookout for &ebetter recipes&r! &6Fine Annealed Copper Wire&r doubles your yield, and &9Polyethylene&r unlocks a few more efficient recipes.
moni.quest.591A1B8B279DFCC9.title: Diodes
moni.quest.59219D37B5CE80E6.title: Causality Exempt Monic Heavy Plating
moni.quest.59219D37B5CE80E6.description1:
Imagine if we could sandwich all of the strongest Microminer platings together with some &6Monium&r, creating something truly impossible and incredible. 

&9If only we had the knowledge to be able to assemble something like that...&r
moni.quest.5928FCBF99CF031B.title: Element 035: Bromine
moni.quest.595F205B551A53C9.description1: &9Nitrogen Dioxide&r, &9Oxygen&r, and &9Water&r will create &9Nitric Acid&r, the next step in your chemical journey.
moni.quest.595F205B551A53C9.description2: &9Nitrogen Dioxide&r can be made with a simple combination of &9Nitric Oxide&r and &9Oxygen&r, or skipped entirely with the &3Large Chemical Reactor.&r
moni.quest.595F205B551A53C9.subtitle: Don't let the EPA catch you making this stuff.
moni.quest.595F205B551A53C9.title: Nitric Acid
moni.quest.599012DB0B179B3B.description1: Crush your &6Sand&r into &6Quartz Sand&r. Can be centrifuged into useful resources.
moni.quest.59C4DA6088B9BC7D.title: Element 005: Boron
moni.quest.59CC348BC6199793.description1:
&6Saplings&r can be dropped when breaking leaves of the corresponding type of tree.

You'll want to aim for &6Rubber saplings&r in particular, since they provide &6Sticky Resin&r when harvested.
moni.quest.59CC348BC6199793.title: Sapling
moni.quest.5A07988F5AD20A06.title: &9Optical Circuit Board
moni.quest.5A25A4DEF1CCA576.title: Element 020: Calcium
moni.quest.5A31EEF439212D6E.title: ZPM Assembler
moni.quest.5A31EEF439212D6E.decription1: You will need &6Fine Europium Wire&r to make &6ZPM Electric Motors&r, so make sure you have a steady supply.
moni.quest.5A31EEF439212D6E.decription2: With the &3Elite Assembler III&r, you can now make &6Trinium Coils&r.
moni.quest.5A70898C99B828E3.description1: The &3Simulation Quantum Computer&r is a direct upgrade to the &3Simulation Supercomputer&r, allowing the use of Parallel hatches to further boost speed and efficiency.
moni.quest.5A70898C99B828E3.description2: As an end-game structure, it is rather expensive to make. However, it is an investment that will easily pay for itself as you progress through the endgame. You should strongly consider making one of these with one of your first few &6Hearts Of A Universe&r.
moni.quest.5A70898C99B828E3.title: &9Simulation Quantum Computer
moni.quest.5A83E1115F965393.description1: If you've tried to insert or remove a lot of items quickly, you might notice your ME network &eflickers offline&r briefly. This is because digitizing and re-materializing items requires energy!
moni.quest.5A83E1115F965393.description2: Your network doesn't naturally store very much energy and the &6Energy Acceptor&r only intermittently refills the network's power. To keep things stable, you will need to add some energy storage in your network using &6Energy Cells&r.
moni.quest.5A83E1115F965393.description3: Just place one anywhere in your network and it will fill up with AE energy received from the Energy Acceptor. Now, you should have enough energy in your network to prevent these power losses. Feel free to add more energy cells, or upgrade to &6Dense Energy Cells&r if you continue to experience problems.
moni.quest.5A83E1115F965393.description4: If you've opted to enable channels in your AE2 configs or are playing Expert Mode, you will innately have some energy storage from the &3ME Controller&r, but we assume you know what you're doing at that point. &eThe mechanics of AE2 Channels are outside the scope of the quest book, and this is the only time it will be mentioned.
moni.quest.5A83E1115F965393.subtitle: Oops… a blackout!
moni.quest.5A83E1115F965393.title: Energy Cell
moni.quest.5A8D2BFAF02E6325.description1:
Putting batches of &6Quantum Circuit&r parts inside of miniaturized microverses and mounting them to a processing unit allows you to create the best Tier Eight circuit, the &6Extradimensional Processor&r. Be warned, this circuit theme will put both your Microverse management skills and your earlier circuit infrastructure to the test.

&6Complex SMD Components&r are now mandatory.
moni.quest.5A8D2BFAF02E6325.subtitle: The Beginning of The End
moni.quest.5A8D2BFAF02E6325.title: &9The Fourth And Final Tier Eight Circuits
moni.quest.5A94534682807314.description1: Unlike &aRF power&r, which is safe to transport with &bLaserIO&r, &aEU power &erequires caution&r. The key is to always &amatch or exceed&r the &eVoltage &rand&e Amperage&r of your power source with your &6cables&r and machines.
Transporting &aEU power &erequires caution&r. The key is to always &amatch or exceed&r the &eVoltage &rand&e Amperage&r of your power source with your &6cables&r and machines.
moni.quest.5A94534682807314.description2: &cNEVER &rhook up your Energy Converter&r to a cable that has fewer &eAmps&r than your Energy Converter or Battery Buffer generates. For example, you must use &64x cable&r for a 4A Converter&r, and &616x cable&r for a filled 16-slot Battery Buffer&r. Cables with insufficient amperage rating will &cburn and be destroyed&r.

&cNEVER &rhook up your Turbine&r to a cable that has fewer &eAmps&r than your Turbine or Battery Buffer generates. For example, you must use &64x cable&r for a 4A Converter&r, and &616x cable&r for a filled 16-slot Battery Buffer&r. Cables with insufficient amperage rating will &cburn and be destroyed&r.
moni.quest.5A94534682807314.description3: Similarly, your cable must match or exceed the &eVoltage&r of your machines, or they will &cburn and be destroyed&r.
moni.quest.5A94534682807314.description4: &cNEVER&r connect a machine to excessive &eVoltage&r or it will &cvaporize&r. Touching a &6wire&r with connected &aEU power&r will &cinjure or kill you&r, so for your safety, &euse &6cables&e instead&r!
moni.quest.5A94534682807314.description5: &2Superconductor-type wires do not damage you in GTm. The 0-loss wires (Conductive Iron, Energetic Alloy, etc.) are considered Superconductors.
moni.quest.5A94534682807314.title: A Primer on Power
moni.quest.5B0200011DF8E1B6.description1: &3Electrolyzers&r use electricity to separate items into their more basic components.
moni.quest.5B0200011DF8E1B6.description2: For example, you can break down Water into &9Hydrogen Gas&r and &9Oxygen Gas&r.
moni.quest.5B0200011DF8E1B6.title: Electrolyzer
moni.quest.5B07A88C0BFF6586.description2: These structures are used to project &eMicroverses&r and send &6Microminers&r into them to obtain valuable loot such as &6ores&r, &6gems&r, and otherwise unobtainable items&r like &6Radon Salt&r and &6Naquadah&r. &eMost Microminers are &6fully reusable&r, including your first one.&r
moni.quest.5B07A88C0BFF6586.description3: Microverse Projectors are &bGregTech&r multiblocks, which means that they're just as flexible as other machines in terms of the I/O block placement: &epositions of Buses and Hatches can be swapped with any Microverse Projector Casing&r.
moni.quest.5B07A88C0BFF6586.description4: A single &6HV Energy Input&r supports missions up to 1024 EU/t. To process the rest, you'll need to upgrade the multiblock to at least &eEV power&r, with either &6two HV Energy Inputs&r or &6one EV Energy Input&r. Missions will also overclock, increasing in speed each time the projector's energy tier increases.
moni.quest.5B07A88C0BFF6586.description5: Hover your mouse over the projector and press &8U&r to see all available missions.
moni.quest.5B07A88C0BFF6586.description6: &6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
moni.quest.5B07A88C0BFF6586.title: &2Basic Microverse Projector
moni.quest.5B0CFF0E0233E98F.description1: Two &aAdvanced Capacitor Banks&r can be grafted together with a &6Vibrant Crystal&r and &6Vibrant Alloy Plates&r to create a &aVibrant Capacitor Bank&r, which stores four times as much RF as the advanced bank, for a total of sixteen times as much as the basic bank.
moni.quest.5B3ABAA58C564CB4.title: Element 019: Potassium
moni.quest.5B3AF79FBDF80C51.description1:
This version of &aME Interface&r acts like four of them at once, allowing for 36 item stacks, or 144 buckets of fluids.
&2Note that the Extended Interface has two pages you can switch between using the arrow button.&r
moni.quest.5B3AF79FBDF80C51.subtitle: Neither do I, check my cousin Extended Pattern Provider instead
moni.quest.5B3AF79FBDF80C51.title: &9Extended Interface
moni.quest.5B52FFEBF5D65C20.description1: To mute a Gregtech machine, right-click it with a &6Hammer&r. (Not the Mining kind!)
moni.quest.5B52FFEBF5D65C20.description2: For other sounds, there is a button in the &etop-left&r of your inventory that looks like a speaker. Clicking it brings you to the &bExtreme Sound Muffler&r menu.
moni.quest.5B52FFEBF5D65C20.description3: In this menu you can &eattenuate the volume of sounds that were recently played&r, or set an "Anchor" to reduce the volume of sounds in that area - most of the controls in this menu have a tooltip to tell you what they do.
moni.quest.5B52FFEBF5D65C20.subtitle: My poor ears!
moni.quest.5B52FFEBF5D65C20.title: &9Muting and Muffling
moni.quest.5B6811964444497F.description1: Circuits along this line are LV, and can all be substituted in recipes.
moni.quest.5B6811964444497F.description2: &2Electronic Circuits&r are the worst in terms of cost and effort required to produce, but you have to start with something.
moni.quest.5B6811964444497F.description3: &2Integrated Circuits&r are the middle layer between &2Electronic Circuits and Microprocessors.&r
moni.quest.5B6811964444497F.description4: And finally, &2Microprocessors&r, which take the lowest effort.
moni.quest.5B6811964444497F.title: LV Circuits
moni.quest.5B9F1EE13E397DEE.description1: With your &6Titanium&r-based machine hulls and &6Mainframes&r squared away, you can finally get on the path to making an Extreme Voltage &3Circuit Assembling Machine&r.
moni.quest.5B9F1EE13E397DEE.description2: This tier of Assembling Machine unlocks &6Nanoprocessors&r, as well as handling crafting recipes up to EV (2048 EU/t). It can also optionally overclock recipes that consume up to HV power (512 EU/t) for improved speed at the cost of relatively more power.
moni.quest.5B9F1EE13E397DEE.title: &2EV Circuit Assembler
moni.quest.5BADF536443E712D.description2: This Hull is made with &6Darmstadtium, Yttrium Barium Cuprate Cables, and Polybenzimidazole&r.
moni.quest.5BADF536443E712D.title: &2UV Machine Hulls
moni.quest.5BC6DB754207D4A8.description1: &2With Silver, LPICs, NaK, and an HV Assembler, you can finally make HV Energy and Dynamo hatches.
moni.quest.5BC6DB754207D4A8.description2: You should get the gist of making these now, so there will not be further quests on Energy and Dynamo hatches.
moni.quest.5BC6DB754207D4A8.title: &2HV Energy Hatch
moni.quest.5BC89A6032EC5EF5.description1: &6Wafers&r are thin pieces of silicon cut from a &6Silicon Boule&r.
moni.quest.5BC89A6032EC5EF5.description2: Their primary purpose is engraving &6Circuit Wafers&r.
moni.quest.5BC89A6032EC5EF5.description3: You'll be needing huge amounts of these Wafers for circuits. Silicon Boules currently take a very long time to craft, so consider parallelizing the recipe in multiple &3EBF&rs and making a stockpile of them.
moni.quest.5BC89A6032EC5EF5.title: Silicon Wafers
moni.quest.5BE41497CBA97FE5.description1: &9ME Packing Tape&r allows you to easily move &6ME Drives&r and &6Pattern Providers&r by packaging them up, which will retain their contents, such as cells and patterns.
moni.quest.5BE41497CBA97FE5.subtitle: Packin' up!
moni.quest.5BE41497CBA97FE5.title: &9ME Packing Tape
moni.quest.5BE9EDB88D656840.description1: &6Rutile&r, &6Carbon&r, and &9Chlorine&r may be chemically reacted to form &9Titanium Tetrachloride&r.
moni.quest.5BE9EDB88D656840.description2: This fluid is a precursor for metallic &6Titanium&r, as well as a titanium halide useful for catalyzing various polymer reactions (like plastics) for greater yields.
moni.quest.5BE9EDB88D656840.title: Titanium Tetrachloride
moni.quest.5C4E189A3E401566.description1: You might notice that these hulls can be made more cheaply in an &3Assembling Machine&r, but you don't have that weird fluid. Don't worry, you'll be able to make that soon.
moni.quest.5C4E189A3E401566.description2: &2MV machines and higher are capable of Overclocking: Each machine tier above the required tier for a recipe allows the machine to run at 2x the speed for 4x the power. While there is usually little reason not to seek higher speed, you might want to build more lower tier machines rather than few for some passive processes if you're short on power.
moni.quest.5C4E189A3E401566.description3: Additionally, ULV recipes will not overclock to LV. A ≤8 EU/t recipe won't overclock at all in an LV machine, will only overclock once in an MV machine, etc.
moni.quest.5C4E189A3E401566.subtitle: Your first MV hull marks the start of your transition into MV.
moni.quest.5C4E189A3E401566.title: &2MV Machine Hulls
moni.quest.5C549B001A8AB62F.title: Element 055: Caesium
moni.quest.5C78349343BA40D7.description1: Time to upgrade your &3Electric Blast Furnace&r! &6Kanthal&r is the second coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 2700K so it can process more advanced materials.
moni.quest.5C78349343BA40D7.description2: &6Kanthal Coils&r are required primarily for producing &6Silicon&r, required for Circuit parts, and &6Titanium&r, used for &5EV&r machines. An &bMV &3Assembler&r is required to produce them, and they require &62x Kanthal Wire&r, &6Aluminium Foil&r, and &9Liquid Copper&r.
moni.quest.5C78349343BA40D7.description3: &2In GTm, using higher-tier coils provides some bonuses to their multiblocks.&r For the &3Electric Blast Furnace&r, running recipes hotter than required can reduce the energy cost and time taken. The &9temperature&r of the EBF depends on the coil used and the voltage it is running at. For Kanthal Coils, this means that recipes you could run with &6Cupronickel Coils&r will save &95%%&r energy.
moni.quest.5C78349343BA40D7.description4: Refer to the coil tooltip and EBF controller tooltip for the other bonuses provided.
moni.quest.5CFBAB5F83E33064.description1: Same deal as Hardened Components, but even faster.
moni.quest.5CFBAB5F83E33064.description2: Dynamos operate at &a250%% of base power generation and fuel burn rate&r.
moni.quest.5CFBAB5F83E33064.description3: Machines operate at &a250%% of base speed&r.
moni.quest.5CFBE0455A242AEB.title: Quests Are Here to Help
moni.quest.5CFBE0455A242AEB.description1: This questbook is made to help you throughout your entire playthrough. &eIt is &lHIGHLY&r&e advised to read it!&r
moni.quest.5CFBE0455A242AEB.description2:
Most questbook chapters use dependencies (the lines with arrows) to signify which quests to do in what order. When a quest is gray-ed out and has a locked icon, it means that one or more of its dependency quests are not completed. 

The dependencies of a quest can be seen by clicking on the left arrow to the left of the Tasks. You can also see what quests depend on this quest using the right arrow to the right of the Rewards.
moni.quest.5CFBE0455A242AEB.description3: If you complete the tasks for a quest before you've completed its dependencies, the quest will display a gray check mark, and will be instantly completed when unlocked. These pre-completed quests won't count as completed for other quests that depend on it while locked.
moni.quest.5CFBE0455A242AEB.description4: When looking for a quest, try using Control/Command + F to search for a quest based on its name or tasks.
moni.quest.5CFBE0455A242AEB.description5: Note that if you are playing Hard or Expert Mode, a few quests may not be entirely accurate.
moni.quest.5D0A642048AF909B.description1: &6RTM Alloy&r is an alloy of &6Ruthenium&r, &6Tungsten&r and &6Molybdenum&r, hence the name.
moni.quest.5D0A642048AF909B.description2: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r and cooled in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r.
moni.quest.5D0A642048AF909B.description3: For now, &6Ruthenium&r must be processed from &6Platinum Group Sludge&r.
moni.quest.5D0A642048AF909B.title: &9RTM Alloy
moni.quest.5D1DAC23C6B89AC3.description1: This element exists but is not needed for the Mote of Omnium.
moni.quest.5D1DAC23C6B89AC3.title: Nothing
moni.quest.5D5B76387841C3FA.description1: &6&6Redstone&r, &6Obsidian Dust&r, and &6Basalz Powder&r creates &6Petrotheum Dust&r, a mixture imbued with potent elemental earth.
moni.quest.5D5C24BACC649253.description1: All furnaces from &bIron Furnaces&r can be augmented to be &afaster&r, more &afuel efficient&r, and &asmelt multiple items at once&r!
moni.quest.5D5C24BACC649253.subtitle: Modular furnaces!
moni.quest.5D5C24BACC649253.title: Furnace Augments
moni.quest.5D60CAE3A33000C3.description1: The &6Steam Foundry&r functions as 5.3 &7LV &3Alloy Smelters&r in parallel! It requires an input of &9Steam&r through a &eSteam Hatch&r, but it uses very little Steam, perfect for bulk crafting alloys or mold recipes.
moni.quest.5D60CAE3A33000C3.title: &9Steam Foundry
moni.quest.5D97206C8135872B.description1: No hoops to jump through here. Smelt &6Wood Logs&f to get &6Charcoal&f. It will serve you well as a fuel source until you locate a vein of &6Coal&f.
&2For making Charcoal for smelting, and Creosote, which can be used as furnace fuel, boiler fuel, and for Treated Planks.
&2For making Charcoal for smelting, and Creosote, which can be used as furnace fuel, boiler fuel, and for Treated Planks.
moni.quest.5D97206C8135872B.description2: Use up to 5 Coke Oven Hatches for automation.
Use up to 5 Coke Oven Hatches for automation.
moni.quest.5DA5231489336B1B.description1: &9Water&r and &9Chlorine&r can be combined to make &9Hypochlorous Acid&r. If you add &9Mercury&r to catalyze the reaction, the yield is much better.
moni.quest.5DA5231489336B1B.description2: &ePlease note that Hypochlorous Acid and Hydrochloric Acid are different things.&r
moni.quest.5DA5231489336B1B.description3: You're already familiar with Chlorine production from your forays into Plastics, but a great source of Mercury is &2centrifuging &6Redstone&r.
moni.quest.5E2489DE2E840738.description1: This needs an &6HV&r Chemical Reactor. &9Dimethylamine&r and &9Monochloramine&r combine together into &9Dimethylhydrazine&r. &2You can also combine Methanol, Ammonia, and Hypochlorous Acid.
moni.quest.5E2489DE2E840738.title: Dimethylhydrazine
moni.quest.5E829641B6FE96E5.description1: At this point, making circuits is beyond second nature for you, so you know what to do.
moni.quest.5E829641B6FE96E5.title: &9The Second Tier Ten Circuit
moni.quest.5EB185AD9BD0D069.description1: Place down a &6Waystone&r, set a memorable name (and enable &6Global&r if you want other players to access it), in order to be able to easily warp to that location, either using a &6Warp Scroll&r, a &6Warp Stone&r or a second Waystone.
moni.quest.5EB185AD9BD0D069.title: &9Thinking with Waystones
moni.quest.5ECF0A787D861C89.description1: The final form of Tier Six circuits.
moni.quest.5ECF0A787D861C89.description2: Using your &2Neuro Processing Units&r, you can craft (grow?) these circuits in a &cZPM&r or better &3Circuit Assembler&r.
moni.quest.5ECF0A787D861C89.description3: These are fairly slow to craft and you're going to need decent quantities, so make sure you have good infrastructure for keeping these stocked.
moni.quest.5ECF0A787D861C89.title: &2The Fourth And Final Tier Six Circuits
moni.quest.5EE2338113F22952.title: &9Antimatter Collider
moni.quest.5EE2338113F22952.description1: The &3Antimatter Collider&r is a large multiblock that can generate more energy than you will be able to transport.
moni.quest.5EE2338113F22952.description2: It does so by gathering energy from the annihilation of &6Antimatter Fuel&r and one of two collidants: &6Neutronium&r or &6Infinity&r.
moni.quest.5EE2338113F22952.description3: When building the collider, note that each ring of &6Netherite Casing&r must have its own fluid input hatch, and that only single fluid hatches are accepted.
moni.quest.5EE2338113F22952.description4: &cOnce the collider is turned on, all fluids in both hatches will be constantly consumed.&r Energy will be created for equal amounts of matter and antimatter, with a bonus multiplier for larger batches of collidants.
moni.quest.5EE2338113F22952.description5: &eExcess of either fluid will be destroyed&r. Energy created that doesn't fit into the dynamo/laser hatch &ewill be lost&r.
moni.quest.5F109188BE4D9767.description1: &3Centrifuges&r have a chance of creating additional materials when processing ore dusts. Sometimes it's the main dust, but often it's a different useful material that is otherwise unobtainable.
moni.quest.5F109188BE4D9767.description2: Instead of washing &6impure dusts&r (made from macerating or hammering ores) in a cauldron, you can get more out of each dust by centrifuging it. The same is true of &6pure dusts&r, when you eventually make a &3Washer&r or &3Chemical Bath&r. Note, however, that pure and impure dusts will usually give different byproducts (always check in &bEMI&r).
moni.quest.5F109188BE4D9767.description3: Centrifuges also have other uses like unmixing compound dusts and fluids, or getting &6Rubber Pulp&r, which can be chemically reacted with &6Sulfur&r to efficiently make &9liquid Rubber&r.
moni.quest.5F109188BE4D9767.title: Centrifuge
moni.quest.5F688F22A3DB2ADD.description1: The &3Atomic Reconstructor&r is capable of reconstructing standard materials into special variants.
moni.quest.5F688F22A3DB2ADD.description2: Most important recipes are at &bMV&r, so you'll need one at that tier or higher.
moni.quest.5F688F22A3DB2ADD.title: Atomic Reconstructor
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description1: &aFilters&r are a type of machine cover that controls what items or fluids are allowed to pass through it. They can be used directly on the side of a machine to affect external automation or the machine's &aauto-output functionality&r.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description2: You can also &eplace filters inside of other covers&r to control what items or fluids that cover will interact with. When used in a &6Robot Arm&r, &aItem Filters&r make for a powerful automation tool for &ekeeping specific items in stock&r in specific quantities in Machines. With &6Fluid Regulators&r, similar behavior is possible with fluids using a &aFluid Filter&r. For &6Conveyors&r and &6Pumps&r, it simply limits what that cover will move.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description3: &aFilters&r all have 9 configurable slots and whitelist/blacklist modes, and can be applied to multiple sides of machines. When placed inside a &6Robot Arm&r in &eKeep Exact&r or &eSupply Exact&r mode&r, the item count in a filter can be incremented by &eright clicking&r and decremented by &eleft clicking&r. Holding &eShift&r causes the count to increase/decrease by a factor of 2. This controls the number of each type of item that will be kept in stock or moved at a time.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description4: Similar controls are available for the &aFluid Filter&r when placed inside a &6Fluid Regulator&r.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description5: Additionally, the &aTag Filter&r&r is a powerful tool that has a specialized filter which uses Tags and &rboolean expressions &r, e. g. '&6forge:hot_ingots&r' will match all hot ingots, '&6forge:dusts&r' will match all regular dusts, and '&6forge:tiny_dusts&r' will match all tiny piles.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description6: Tags are used similarly in the &eTag Export Bus&r.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.description7: All &bGregTech&r Filters can be configured using ghost items from &bEMI&r.
moni.quest.5F6B13DBCABA5078.title: &2Filters
moni.quest.5F90D0FC382C0A30.description1: The &6Steam Separator&r functions as 5.3 &7LV &3Centrifuges&r in parallel! It requires an input of &9Steam&r through a &eSteam Hatch&r, but it uses very little Steam.
The &6Steam Separator&r functions as 5.3 &7LV &3Centrifuges&r in parallel! It requires an input of &9Steam&r through a &eSteam Hatch&r, but it uses very little Steam.
moni.quest.5F90D0FC382C0A30.description2: While it can't process &9fluids&r, it's perfect for ore processing, letting you get the most out of your dusts and letting you not have to deal with washing your ores in a &3Cauldron&r.
While it can't process &9fluids&r, it's perfect for ore processing, letting you get the most out of your dusts and letting you not have to deal with washing your ores in a &3Cauldron&r.
moni.quest.5F90D0FC382C0A30.description3: You may wish to wait until you have a Bender at LV to reduce the cost.
You may wish to wait until you have a Bender at LV to reduce the cost.
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.description1: These devices can help you build, swap blocks, destroy massive areas, or even copy-paste regions. You need the blocks you plan to paste in your inventory though; it doesn't make them from nothing.
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.description2: Also important to note is that it can act wonky with Tile Entities, so it is mainly useful with simple blocks (it doesn't paste machine or hatch configuration, for example).
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.description3: A very cool feature of this mod is how you can &8shift-right click&r an inventory with any gadget (if you are using a &6Copy-Paste Gadget&r to do this, it must be on &ePaste&r mode) and the gadget will pull items from the inventory, 'connecting' the gadget to the inventory.
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.description4: For example, if you &8shift-right click&r a chest full of &6Cobblestone&r, the gadget will use &6Cobblestone&r from that chest to place blocks.
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.description5: By default, the config GUI is bound to &8G&r.
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.subtitle: This pack has &bBuilding Gadgets&r.
moni.quest.5F9C7FB40AD2640B.title: Inspector Gadget
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.description1: &9Deepslate Processing is a great way to get tons of Fluorine and Thorium. Therefore, it is recommended to setup this process as soon as possible.&r
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.description2: &6Fluorine&r is needed in &6Polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE)&r, and many future chemical processes.
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.description3: &3Rock Breakers&r are first used to achieve renewable &6Deepslate&r. This recipe runs at &5EV&r or higher.
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.description4: After this, &3Macerators&r should pulverise the Deepslate into &6Deepslate Dust&r, with a chance of producing &6Thorium&r.
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.description5: A &3Centrifuge&r then turns Deepslate Dust into &6Biotite Dust&r and &6Silicon Dioxide Dust&r. The latter can be electrolysed, yielding &6Silicon&r and &6Oxygen&r.
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.description6: Biotite Dust is then finally put into an &3Electrolyser&r. This yields &6Potassium, Magnesium, Aluminium&r and &6Silicon Dust&r, as well as some &6Fluorine&r.
moni.quest.5FB696EF1D2412F5.title: &9Deepslate Processing
moni.quest.5FE96C30454A0374.description1: The first source of &9Warden Hearts&r and the only source of &9Lair of The Warden Data&r.
moni.quest.5FE96C30454A0374.description2: As a bonus, it also brings back &9Sculk Catalysts, Warden Tendrils, &2Blocks of Ruthenium&r, and plenty of other different precious metals and gems.
moni.quest.5FE96C30454A0374.title: &9Tier Seven Microminer
moni.quest.5FF33EF493DB7E01.description1: There are several paths to &9Acetic Acid&r. The simplest is combining &9Oxygen&r, &9Hydrogen&r, and &6Carbon&r, but one of the several other methods may appeal to you more, especially if you have a &3Distillation Tower&r.
moni.quest.5FF33EF493DB7E01.description2: Look through &bEMI&r for the various options.
moni.quest.5FF33EF493DB7E01.title: Acetic Acid
moni.quest.601A47A727AC3BD2.title: Quasi-Stable Neutron Stars
moni.quest.601A47A727AC3BD2.description1: The final Nether Star tier. These will be used in &6Multidimensional CPU Wafers&r as well as &aUEV&r and &l&cMAX&r&r &6Emitters&r, &6Sensors&r, and &6Field Generators&r.
moni.quest.601A47A727AC3BD2.subtitle: The Heaven-Sent Abomination
moni.quest.604CCBE824D03A74.description1: &9Machine Hulls&r, along with circuits, are used in nearly every &bGregTech&r machine.
moni.quest.604CCBE824D03A74.description2: With over 50 uses for each tier of machine hull, you'll want to make a lot of these.
moni.quest.604CCBE824D03A74.subtitle: The First of Many
moni.quest.604CCBE824D03A74.title: &2LV Machine Hulls
moni.quest.605062720747B482.description1: With &6Tungstensteel&r achieved, you can now make hulls for Insane Voltage (IV) &bGregTech&r machines.
moni.quest.605062720747B482.title: &2IV Machine Hulls
moni.quest.60B16BB064E2FF4C.description1: &2The Cracker gives you higher yields from cracking organic substances.
moni.quest.60B16BB064E2FF4C.description2: &2In GTm, many organic substances offer the option of being Severely or Lightly cracked, as well as Hydro or Steam cracked, with each one granting different ratios of distillates.
moni.quest.60B16BB064E2FF4C.title: &2Cracker
moni.quest.60BC08DE447E5007.description1: Used for storing really big amounts of things, like in a &664k ME Storage Cell&r.
moni.quest.60BC08DE447E5007.subtitle: The penultimate item storage component in &bApplied Energistics&r.
